Also, his service is not equaled by anyone's and he is always ready to take care of his customers. José Benjamín is an admirable, hard-working man with many goals ahead. He is always keeping an eye on new opportunities that might pave his way to success. He wants to increase his production this harvesting season but he needs some capital for it, therefore he is asking a loan from INTEGRAL in order to purchase seeds, manure, insecticide, herbicide, tools, etc. José Benjamín has good credit references and he assures he will be able to pay his debt and offer his family a better quality of life at the same time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, insecticide, herbicide and tools

loans.name: Den-Den

texts.en:
This is Den-Den. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used for purchasing necessary equipment and materials for the barber shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy new equipment and materials needed for her barber shop. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Den-Den hopes that her business will continue to be successful. It is also her desire to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new equipment and materials needed for her barber shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Elizabeth will use the loan to buy sacks of dry maize, beans and wheat for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her grandchildren. Her hopes and dreams are to build a store for storing her cereals and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy dry maize, beans and wheat for sale in her business.

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Batbaatar, 24, sells clothes with his wife. They have been operating their business for last 3 years and own 3 stalls.  Batbaatar is a very hardworking and fair young man, as his coworkers identified him. Currently he lives with his wife and his parents in the ger district, a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurts district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In summer and autumn, he has big sales of clothes for women, men and kids. Lately, his stock has been decreased and he wanted to increase it before this autumn. It is a very good chance to enlarge his sales volume and earn extra profits. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to buy casual clothes to increase his working capital.  In addition, he has a plan to have a baby in the next year.

loans.use: To buy casual clothes to increase his working capital.

loans.name: Ma. Soledad

texts.en:
Ma. Soledad is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a scrap business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional scrap to sell.

Ma. Soledad has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from raising pigs and selling dried coconut meat.

Ma. Soledad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional scrap to sell

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is 40 years old and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to be a successful business woman. Her lifetime partner is a director of lyceum of their region, and they have 4 children. They live in the house she has succeeded in building thanks to her husband's great dedication.

Fotima is one of the smart businesswomen of her region. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop business and in this way improve their living condition. Her elder daughter helps her with the business. She wants to develop business further, but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy.

This is the 6th loan she is requesting from MLO IMON and she feels deeply grateful for the economic support she has received to achieve her goals. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 TJS to buy children’s clothes as school uniform for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes as school uniforms

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is an enterprising woman who earns a living through selling cashew nuts at the market. Her husband sells coconuts and together they make sure that their three children have all the basic needs including education. Thanks to their efforts, all three children are in school.

Mwanakombo has been in business for two years and she aims to open a depot so as to increase her clientele and sales. She lives in her own house that is thatched, with mud walls. However, she does not die hard and she has the faith and determination that she will one day own a permanent house that has all the facilities.

Mwanakombo has requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for sale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for sale.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Altantsetseg, 37, is a seamstress in a private tailoring company in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been doing her work for three years. His husband, Tsedenbal, 37, operates a car wash, but he has not enough numbers of clients usually.  Because of that, he runs a taxi around the city in the nights to earn extra income. Altantsetseg lives with her husband and her 2 daughters in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt. Altantsetseg is requesting a loan to buy a car which runs on natural-gas. She and her husband both know that using natural gas is healthful and important to the people’s health and environment. The loan she is taking will be used to cover the cost of the car that uses natural gas.

loans.use: To buy a car which runs on natural-gas.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
To earn a living, Saumu works extra hard to cater to the needs of her family.  She and her husband have three children, ages eight, six and eight months. She lives in the coastal region of Kenya. Saumu sells coconuts as wholesale to a neighboring coconut oil manufacturing firm. Her goal is to see that her children become professionals, since they are the source of joy for their marriage.

Demand for supplying more coconuts has increased but she is financially challenged, so she is requesting a loan so as to expand her supplies by buying more stock of coconuts for sale. This will allow her to maintain her customers even as she provides them with good services.

loans.use: buying more stock of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Evelia

texts.es: Rosa Evelia de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite mejorar su labor y obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo se ubica en una zona de incidencia agrícola muy cercano a su residencia, comercia en los lugres aledaños a la localidad y tiene mucha clientela fija, pues las personas lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable; Rosa es una mujer admirable, enérgica, y con muchos sueños que desea alcanzar, siempre esta buscando oportunidades que le abran puertas al éxito, el ultimo año de siembra tuvo muchas perdidas debido al clima, quiere recuperarse pero no posee suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, herbicida, abono, herramienta, etc. Rosa Evelia tiene buenas referencias de pago y asegura poder saldar la deuda, al mismo tiempo que confía que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Rosa Evelia, 42, lives with her children. She makes a living by farming, particularly corn. She has been working on this field for many years and has gained precious experience that allows her to improve her technique and get the best harvests. Her land plot is located in a highly agricultural zone, very close to her home too. She sells her produce nearby her community and has a lot of regular customers. People prefer her because she always has what they need: high-quality products at an affordable price, besides an unparalleled service. Rosa is an admirable woman, full of energy and dreams she wishes to fulfill. She is always looking for opportunities that can pave her way to success. In the previous planting season she had many losses because of the weather. She wants to recover but doesn't have enough capital and that is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to purchase bean and corn seeds, herbicides, manure, tools, etc. Rosa Evelia has good credit references and she assures she will be able to pay her debt while offering her family economic security.

loans.use: purchase bean and corn seeds, herbicides, manure, tools

loans.name: Joylen

texts.en:
Joylen is 44 years old and married with one child.

Joylen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a engine lubricant retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 35000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Joylen has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the engine lubricant retail for 10 years and also earns an income from selling gasoline.

Joylen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is 61 years old and married. 

Ludy buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines. Ludy has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

Ludy has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Ludy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor vive en la ciudad de Milagros en una pequeña finca propiedad de sus padres, el negocio al que se dedica proviene desde hace varios años ya que es un negocio familiar. Hace poco formo su familia por lo que se dedica con más esfuerzo a su trabajo. El se dedica a la venta de leña y carbón ya que su finca tiene gran cantidad de arboles los cuales han sido plantados por varias de sus generaciones. En la atención le ayuda su esposa ya que a veces él se encuentra cortando la leña, lo cual es un proceso muy largo y pesado, esto es porque Víctor no tiene maquinaria. Trabaja todo el día esto no se le complica porque está acostumbrado al trabajo pesado, su mayor problema es la falta de transporte el cual necesita para entregar la leña y el carbón cuando tiene los pedidos. Hace varios meses se dio cuenta que el lugar donde hace el carbón es pequeño por eso se le agota rápidamente, con el crédito que solicita va adecuar el lugar, también invertirá en arboles para la leña. Su sueño a futuro es poderle ayudar a su esposa a reunir un capital para que pueda empezar su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Victor lives in the town of Milagros on a small farm belonging to his parents. He has run the family business for several years. He has a family of his own now so works even harder. Victor sells firewood and charcoal as the farm has a lot of trees planted by many generations of the family.

His wife helps him with the business as he is sometimes busy cutting the wood, a long and strenuous job because he doesn't own any machinery. Victor works every day; this doesn't bother him as he is accustomed to hard work. His biggest problem is the lack of transportation to deliver the wood and charcoal when his customers have given him orders.

A few months ago he realized that the place where he makes the charcoal was small and he was rapidly running out of wood. With the loan he plans to renovate the place and also buy some more trees to make firewood.

His dream is to help his wife to save enough money so that she can start her own business.

loans.use: With his firewood and charcoal business

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa is 48 years old and married with 6 children. With 4 children in school, Flordelisa works very hard to provide for them.

Flordelisa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Flordelisa has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soap, sugar, milk, etc. 

In the future, Flordelisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with three children between the ages of seven years and seven months. She is married to Hamadi, a businessman. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Bahati is a woman of high integrity who always tries whenever opportunities arise. She likes to see herself move forward in life. For the last three years, she has been engaged in the selling of petroleum at the market, a business she is still doing up to this date, her primary customers being motorcycle-taxi operators. She says that her customers like her due to her good services and the fair price of her petrol. Bahati is a visionary woman who dreams of owning a petrol station in the future. The urge to expand her business makes her ask for a loan in the amount of KES 50,000 to purchase gallons of petrol for sale. The previous loan helped her to increase her sales and her income in general.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of petrol for sale.

loans.name: Aye Ofe Wahala Group

texts.fr: AYE OFE WAHALA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine et sont liés par un lien de parenté. La représentante du groupe, Mignondo (qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée 52 ans. Mignondo est mariée à un certain Ayadji. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont trois à leur charge. Mignondo vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Mignondo vend des tissus et des bijoux par le système de distribution. Mignondo s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Mignondo s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe AYE OFE WAHALA pour consentir un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
AYE OFE WAHALA is a group of three persons whose members belong to the same tontine and who are bound by family relationships. The group's representative, Mignondo (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 52 years old and married to a man named Ayadji. The couple have five children, all educated, of whom three are in their care. Mignondo lives together with her children and husband. The couple jointly ensure that the household expenses are covered. 

To support herself, Mignondo sells cloth and jewelry via the distribution system. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying customer demands, Mignondo joined with the other members of the group AYE OFE WAHALA to agree to a third loan with ALIDé. The first two loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy cloth and jewelry to resell

loans.name: Bitossessi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BITOSSESSI est composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Florence est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Florence est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Florence est mariée à un maçon du nom de Gildas. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Florence vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec  son mari les charges de la maison. Florence n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce à son domicile depuis douze ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Florence vend des mèches et des produits de cheveux. Florence s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Florence sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BITOSSESSI, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group BITOSSESSI is composed of four persons who are friends living in the same village. The group's representative, Florence, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 34 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a mason named Gildas. The couple have six children, some in school but all in their care. Florence lives together with her husband and children and, along with her husband, ensures that the household expenses are covered. 

Florence did not attend school but learned how to style hair. She has been doing this work in her home for twelve years. Parallel to this business, she sells hair extensions and hair products. She gets her supplies from her region. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Florence is requesting, along with the other members of the group BITOSSESSI, a third loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and hair products

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Christy runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Christy has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Christy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old and widowed with 4 children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Elena has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Elena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 54 years old and married with 1 child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Eva runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Eva has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, milk, soft drink, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Eva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely works hard to support her family. Fely is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Fely has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Fely has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Fely would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki, 25, is a resident of Mwambalazi, a small village on the south coast of Kenya. She is a woman who dreams of progressing in life. After being a farmer for some time and running a retail shop, she decided to start another business so as to increase her monthly income. In 2010, she decided to start a coconut-selling business, selling to the neighboring countryside since there was demand. She stocks the coconuts in her shop.

Riziki is working hard to ensure that she provides for her children and also can help her husband, who is a businessman, with the household expenses. She says that her major challenge is transportation cost and that she dreams of expanding her business and opening new businesses in the future. Riziki has insufficient capital to increase her inventory, so she is asking for help from Yehu to add stock of coconuts for sale. This will enable her to increase her profits and provide a quality life for her family.

loans.use: to add stock of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Roman

texts.es: El Sr. Román de 52 años de edad es casado y no tiene dependientes económicos. El trabaja como guardia de seguridad mientras que su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica en casa particulares. Román siempre se ha propuesto brindarle lo mejor a su esposa es por esto que en esta ocasión solicita de nuestra ayuda para la compra de cemento para en un futuro poder realizar trabajos de construcción en su casa, más específicamente una dala  esto quiere decir que hará una zanja y  la rellenara con cemento ya que en las temporadas de lluvia el agua siempre entra a su casa. El agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: 52-year old Román is married but doesn't have any financial dependents. He works as a security guard; his wife is a servant in a private house. Román has always tried to give his wife the best he can so he is now seeking a loan to buy cement so that in the future he can do some construction work on the house. He wishes to install a pipe in a trench lined with cement so that in the rainy season the water doesn't come into the house. He is grateful for the help that is being offered.

loans.use: Buy cement

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen earns her living by running a general store. Her earnings help to fund the education of her child and support her household and business expenditures. She previously received a loan in the amount of PhP 24,000, which she used to purchase greater quantities and varieties of the grocery items and products needed in her business. 

She would like to apply for another PhP 25,000 loan so that she can buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. She believes that the more items she can display at the store, the better. Offering a larger selection will bring her a better profit. The increased profits from her business will help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
 
Helen hopes to be able to expand her business soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products to sell in her store

loans.name: Eliverta

texts.en:
Eliverta, age 42, raises livestock. She started this business 20 years ago when she and her husband had no income, and it has remained their only income in the years since. Her husband takes the milk to the local market almost every day to offer for sale. 

They have two teenaged children who attend the public high school. The village where the family resides, in the southeastern part of Albania, does not have such a school, so the children go to a different one within the same commune. Eliverta’s dream is for both of their children to attend university, because both of them do very well in school. 

Eliverta has received and repaid four previous loans, and she is now requesting her fifth. The loan funds will be used to purchase a milk cow. She made her application some time ago at the VisionFund Albania institution, but it remained on their waiting list until recently, when the local branch contacted her with the possibility of raising funds through Kiva. She was thrilled, and she is very appreciative of the help she hopes to receive from her potential Kiva lenders. She thanks them for their kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Midoukpo 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIDOUKPO 1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui s'approvisionnent au même endroit. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Bihountou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Bihountou est âgée de 52 ans et est une veuve. Bihountou n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Bihountou n’a pas d’enfant et vit seule à sa propre charge. Pour assurer ses différents besoins, Bihountou vend depuis une trentaine d’années, des condiments dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Bihountou s’approvisionne dans une ville et dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Bihountou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIDOUKPO 1, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group MIDOUKPO 1 is composed of three persons who are friends and who supply themselves from the same location. The group's representative, Bihountou, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 52 years old and a widow. She did not attend school and has no children. She lives alone and supports herself. 

To meet her different needs, Bihountou has been selling condiments at a market in Benin for about thirty years. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a city in a region of Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Bihountou is requesting, along with the other members of the group MIDOUKPO 1, a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Ángel Santiago

texts.es: Ángel Santiago de veintiséis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas para la venta, el terreno de cultivo es ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola, accesible y con suelo fértil adecuado para la siembra, comercia en todos los alrededores de la zona y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que siempre tiene lo que necesitan a con producto de calidad y a precios accesibles además de un buen servicio; Ángel es un hombre entregado a su labor dispuesto a salir adelante, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la producción pues sabe que así logrará aumentar sus ganancias, necesita de capital para la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Ángel Santiago tiene buenas referencias de pago y tiene la certeza que podrá cancelar la deuda y al mismo tiempo tiene confianza que le dará a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Ángel Santiago, twenty-six years old, lives with with his partner in life and in their children. He makes a living in agriculture, particularly through the cultivation of corn and beans. He has worked in this area for many years, and his experience has proved very valuable, allowing him to grow the best possible crops for sale. 

The land he cultivates is located in an area with a great deal of agriculture, since it is accessible, has fertile soil that is good for planting, and since there is commerce in all the surrounding zones. He already has many clients since people know that he always has what they need with quality products and accessible prices in addition to good service.

Ángel is devoted to his work and determined to get ahead. He always is at the ready for new opportunities that will help him achieve success. In this planting season he wants to increase production since he knows that he will be able to increase his earnings this way. He needs capital for the investment, and for this reason he is requesting a loan from Integral to help him buy seeds for rice and beans, insecticide, and herbicide, etc. 

Ángel Santiago has good payment references and he is certain that he will be able to cancel the debt and at the same time confident that the loan will give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy seeds for corn and beans, insecticide, and herbicide.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles owns a shop where he sells cereals and other items. He has been in this line of business for the past five years. He has established a strong customer base, and his aim is to own a bigger cereal shop in the future. He tells us that he usually wakes up early in the morning and works through evening. He lives in his own house in the district of Kwale, Kenya, with his wife and their two children.

Charles’ inventory has gone down, so he needs to increase his stock. However, he does not have sufficient capital to restock his shop. This is why he is taking out a loan from Yehu. The loan will be used to purchase cereals and flour to offer for sale.

loans.use: to purchase cereals and flour to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business by roasting meat and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
This is Nelia, She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs at home and business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nelia hopes to be successful in her business and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine, age 32, sells shoes to earn her living. She has been in this business for seven years. 

She has applied for a loan in order to buy more shoes to offer for sale. With the profits expected from the business, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a man of integrity who runs a timber workshop, a business he has been in for the last three years. His customers call him "Freddy," a short form of Fredrick. Fredrick is married to one beautiful wife and they are blessed with four children, all of whom are in school. His timber depot is located at the market. His major goal in life is to own a hardware store. He promises to invest the profits got into the business in order to expand it.

He has requested a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase a timber-cutting machine. Fredrick hopes to provide a quality life to his family.

loans.use: to purchase a timber-cutting machine.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: In the small village of Mwambalazi, we found Salim living with his family; his wife and their seven children. Both of them have been engaged in farming for the last two years. They grow a variety of fruits and vegetables and he sells them both from home and at the market. Salim has requested a loan so as to invest into his newly established vegetable stall. He sells vegetables and fruits that include tomatoes, bananas, kale, etc. With the loan, he will be able to purchase onions, tomatoes, kale, and other fruits and vegetables to stock his stall. By doing this, he will continue to provide fresh products to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, kale, and other fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana es una pequeña comerciante de venta de tortillas tostadas y suaves, este tipo de producto es elaborado a base de maíz y es muy popular en la comida nicaragüense, su forma de elaboración es artesanal, con sus propias manos, este tipo de trabajo es un arte, porque tiene que calcular la temperatura de su cocina para que las tortillas tostadas queden bien ricas como galletas, sus clientes son dueños de pulperías ubicados en el municipio de san Rafael del sur, Nicaragua.

Su estado civil es acompañada, su esposo trabaja como obrero en un molino de cal, los dos han podido salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades económicas de la zona, por ser personas honestas y emprendedoras, tienen dos niños , uno en tercer grado de primaria, y el otro en pre-escolar.
Doña Ana aprobó el segundo año de secundaria, y desde que conoció a su pareja no siguió estudiando para atender el hogar y sus hijos, sin embargo ella emprendió la idea de poner su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is a small merchant, selling soft and toasted tortillas. This type of product is prepared from corn, and it is very popular in Nicaraguan cooking. She makes the tortillas in the traditional way, with her own hands. This type of work is an art, because she has to calculate the temperature of her cooktop so that her toasted tortillas turn out as delicious as cookies. Her customers are the owners of small neighborhood stores located in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur, Nicaragua.

She is in a common-law marriage, and her husband works as a laborer in a lime mill. Together, they have been able to get ahead in spite of the economic difficulties of the area, because they are honest and enterprising people. They have two children, one in the third grade of primary school, and the other in preschool. 

Ana studied up through the second year of secondary school, but after she met her life partner she did not continue studying, so she could take care of the household and their children. However, she came up with the idea of starting her own business.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as corn, firewood and lime.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.en:
Ilhom, age 35, started his animal husbandry business three years ago, with the goal of improving the living standards of his wife and four children. His business has thrived and he is now one of the most successful and respected businessmen in the local market. He buys cows, cares for them for two or three months, and then sells them to local customers. He ensures that his cows are well-fed so that they consistently attract a lot of customers. 

Currently, Ilhom wishes to buy more cows for his developing business, but he does not have sufficient money for doing so. He is therefore asking for a loan in the amount of 3,000 USD to buy young cattle. In this way, he will be able to provide his family with a higher quality of living, which is his ongoing goal. Moreover, he will be able to enroll his children in good schools. 

Ilhom promises to make his payments regularly and on time. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Gatama

texts.en: Gatama is 37 years old. He has two children aged between one and three. With the loan he wants to buy shoe polish for use in the business and sandals to sell. With the profits from the business he plans to buy cows for rearing.

loans.use: To buy shoe polish to use in the business and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
This is Redentor. He previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his child and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Redentor hopes to be able to expand soon. It is also his desire to give a good and quality education to his child. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Ayisha

texts.en: Ayisha is married and has four children. All go to school except the youngest who is three months old. She usually sells shirts for men and skirts for ladies. She has spent six years in the business. With the loan, she wants to add more shirts and skirts to sell. With the profits from the business, she will pay the school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and skirt to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, age 31, earns a living as a mechanic. He started his business 10 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 28,000. He and his wife Susan are blessed with a nine-year-old child and a one-year-old baby. 

Simon is requesting his third loan in the amount of of KES 80,000, which he will utilize to purchase motor vehicle spare parts. The profit he makes will help him fund the education of his children. 

His dream is someday to own and operate his own garage.

loans.use: o purchase motor vehicle spare parts to facilitate his work

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette, age 45, sells palm oil and peanuts to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for 20 years. She and her husband have four children. 

Jeannette has requested this loan in order to purchase more palm oil and peanuts to offer for sale. She will utilize the expected profits from the business to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and peanuts to offer for sale

loans.name: Mbwana

texts.en:
Mbwana earns his living by managing a retail shop. In front of his shop is a small stall where he sells fruits and vegetables. He and his wife have four children and live in their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mbwana is a determined man who tries to make sure that he utilizes every business opportunity he comes across. This is his third loan with Yehu and he tells us that the loans have been of great benefit to him. Mbwana is working hard to fulfill his dream of opening several retail shops. 

Demand for more products has risen and he does not want to disappoint his customers, so he is requesting a loan in order to increase his stock. By doing this, he will be able to offer a greater number and variety of commodities. The requested loan will be used to purchase wheat flour, rice, sugar, and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, sugar, and vegetables

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy operates a general store business to earn an income. She received a previous loan in the amount of PhP 14,000, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products to sell in her store. Her increased earnings were a big help in terms of paying for her child's education and helped to cover the family's personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would now like to apply for another PhP 15,000 loan. She will utilize her loan funds to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. She believes that the more items that are displayed at the store, the better. Having an expanded inventory will result in better profit. Her increased profits will help her to sustain the family's daily needs and pay for educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Daisy hopes her business will grow in the coming years, and she dreams of being able to give her family a good future and to offer a high-quality education to her child through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: German

texts.es:
Germán es un hombre de 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con su pareja y sus 2 hijos a quienes quiere mucho y son su razón para seguir luchando y esforzándose para sacarlos adelante; él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado ser Profesor; en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia y en algunas ocasiones aprovechan la oportunidad para comer un riquísimo Pollo a la Brasa. 
Con mucho empeño y gracias al apoyo de su familia, día a día Germán trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ladrillos, desde tempranas horas de la mañana él inicia la elaboración de los ladrillos en un pequeño horno artesanal fabricado por él mismo, Germán dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor, ya que cree que le va bien por su buen trabajo y por su trato amable y respetuoso.
Germán se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de pajilla, él cual es uno los materiales importantes para la elaboración de ladrillos; de esta manera Germán espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales desea utilizar para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda adquirir una pequeña moto carga para transportar sus ladrillos y así Germán seguirá esforzándose para asegurar el  bienestar y futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Germán is forty years old and lives in the city of Chiclayo in the Guadalupe district with his partner and two children whom he loves very much and who are his reason for continuing to fight and make the effort to carry them forward. He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person. Unfortunately, because of needing to work and pay his own way, he could not study for a professional career, but he would have liked to be a professor. In his free time he enjoys spending time with his family. On some occasions, they take advantage of the opportunity to eat a delicious barbecued chicken.

With much effort and thanks to the support of his family, Germán works day to day in his little brick-selling business. Very early in the morning, he begins making bricks in a little handcrafted oven that he made himself. Germán dedicates approximately twelve hours a day to his business and feels happy in his work, since he feels that things are going well for him because of his good work and loving and respectful treatment of others. 

Germán is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have provided he will be able to buy straw, which is an important material in brick-making. In this way, Germán hopes to be able to expand his sales and increase his income so that in the not-very-distant future he can save up to buy a little motor car to transport his bricks. Through these efforts, Germán will continue to ensure the well-being and the future of his family.

loans.use:
Para la compra de pajilla.
to buy straw

loans.name: Dhurata

texts.en:
Dhurata, age 31, started an animal husbandry business five years ago, when she and her husband bought five cows in an attempt to raise their family out of poverty. Since then, Dhurata and her husband have been selling dairy products to local dairy farms, who have proved to be good clients to them. Dhurata and her husband tell us that they have been earning reasonably good money from this endeavor, since the demand for dairy is very great among Albanians, who traditionally consume a lot of dairy in different forms, such as cheese, yogurt, cottage cheese, and milk.

Dhurata and her husband have two children, ages six and seven. The family is poor and lives in the southeastern part of Albania. Dhurata believes that her marriage has been hard and life harder because the couple got no help from either her family or his, which is as expected according to Albanian custom, since they were not in any better financial conditions themselves. 

Dhurata is requesting a Kiva loan in order to grow her business by purchasing a milk cow, because she lacks the capital with which to make this purchase on her own. She would like to thank each lender in advance for their generosity and support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is married with four children. He is married to a tailor. He is a cobbler by profession. He wants a loan to buy a machine that will help him make shoes and put rubber on them. The profits expected from this business will be used to buy a house to live in. In the future he would like to have a booming business of his own.

loans.use: To buy a machine to put rubber on shoes.

loans.name: Assia

texts.en: Assia is 28 years old. She is married, with one child who is enrolled in school. With the loan, she wants to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her child’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en: Kwekwe is taking out another loan to expand her existing business. She intends to purchase more goats for sale. Since her previous loan, her business has grown and she says that her income has increased by more than 20%. Kwekwe also tells us that she was able to pay her children's school fees, and provide basic needs for her family. She aims to expand her business and continue providing quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for sale.

loans.name: Fredy Dagoberto

texts.es: Fredy Dagoberto  de cuarenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol y tiene muchos años de trabajar en la agricultura, desde joven aprendió el oficio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite  obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo es arrendado, muy accesible y apto para la siembra, todo lo que produce lo comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además con un buen servicio, se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad; Fredy es un hombre soñador, trabajador, responsable, siempre esta luchando por alcanzar un futuro mejor, en esta época de cosecha quiere aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital para la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, etc. Fredy Dagoberto tiene buen record crediticio por eso asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y además tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Fredy Dagoberto is forty years old and lives with his partner in life and in their children. He makes his living growing corn and beans and has many years of experience in agriculture. He learned the trade as a young man and has made much of his experience, which enables him to grow the best possible crops. He rents the land he cultivates, which is very accessible and good for planting. Everything he produces is sold in surrounding areas of the community. He has many clients that prefer him because he provides first quality produce at accessible prices with good service. He is known for his great friendliness.

Fredy is a dreamer, hardworking, and responsible. He is always fighting to achieve a better future. In this harvest season he wants to expand production but needs capital for the investment. For this reason he is requesting a loan from Integral that will help him buy seeds for corn and beans, fertilizer, and insecticide, etc. Fredy Dagoberto has a good credit record and so is certain that he will be able to cancel the debt within the established period and moreover has confidence that he will be able to give his family a plentiful life.

loans.use: to buy seeds for corn and beens, fertilizer, and insecticide.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 33 years old. She is married and has three children, who are enrolled in school. She has been selling used shoes for the past 15 years. With the loan, she will buy more used shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en: Celestin is 37 years old and is married, with four children. Celestin sells spare parts. He has four years of experience in this work and he currently employs one person to help him. He works from 7 a.m to 7 p.m every day except Saturday. Celestin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more spare parts for resale. With any profits from this loan, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en: Beathe is married to a businessman. They have five children. Only four of them attend school; she can’t afford to have all her children in school at the same time because of financial hardship. She sells sugar and rice in the boutique she has been running for eight years. She has requested the loan to buy more rice and sugar to sell. In the future, she would like to become a wholesaler. The profits from the business will be used to build a house to live in.

loans.use: To buy more rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Joven Luis Alberto es soltero tiene 29 años de edad, desde hace 5 años vive en una casa de interés social con su hermano y su mamá que depende económicamente de ellos. Luis es empleado de una maquiladora de la localidad trabaja 10 horas diarias 5 días de la semana, desempeñándose como operador.  De Jueves a Domingo  prepara aguas frescas de sabores: Melón, Plátano, Limón, Coco y Sandia y el mismo con ayuda de su hermano las venden en el mercado; el decidió emprender este negocio porque trabajo muchos años en una refresquería de la localidad y el vio la posibilidad de tener su negocio propio de esto ya hace 3 años.  El está muy agradecido con su mamá por la educación que ella le dio y se preocupa por su bienestar no quiere que ella sufra las mismas carencias que el sufrió por eso solicita el apoyo para compra de Jarrones para exhibir sus aguas y poder brindar más variedad de sabores a sus clientes.
texts.en: Luis Alberto is 29 years old and has been living in public housing for 5 years with his brother and mother who is financially dependent on them.  Luis works at a local factory as an operator and works 10 hour days, 5 days a week.   From Thursday to Sunday he prepares fresh juice from various flavors, such as: cantaloupe, banana, coco, and watermelon; with the help of his brother they sell them at the local market.  He decided to start his business 3 years ago when he noticed the opportunity while working for a local refreshment company.  He is very thankful to his mother for his upbringing and he worries about her well-being, he doesn´t want her to suffer the same deficiencies he did.  This is why he is seeking a loan to purchase containers to showcase his juices and have the ability to offer more varieties to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase containers

loans.name: Félix Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Félix, es un habitante del municipio de san Rafael del sur, Nicaragua, su actividad económica es la elaboración de cosas de horno y pan casero, productos elaborados a base de harina y maíz, estos productos lo elaboran artesanalmente con sus propias manos, y para cocinarlos construyen un horno artesanal donde lo calientan con carbón.

El antes se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero por las condiciones climáticas no cosechaban lo esperado, sin embargo un día junto con su esposa decidieron en producir estos alimentos que constituyen parte de la dieta de los nicaragüenses.
Durante la entrevista con el cliente nos manifestó un profundo agradecimiento por a la oportunidad brindada en apoyar su actividad económica.
Tiene tres hijos con su esposa, y todos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Félix is a resident of the municipality of San Rafael del Sur, Nicaragua.  His business is making baked goods and homemade bread, which are corn- and flour-based products.  He makes these products himself with his own hands and to bake them they made a homemade oven that is charcoal-heated.

He used to work in agriculture for a living, but the weather conditions did not provide the harvest he expected.  Nevertheless, one day he and his wife decided to make these foods, which are part of the Nicaraguan diet.

In an interview with this borrower, he expressed deep thanks for the opportunity to receive help with his business that he has been offered.  

He has three children with his wife and all of them are school-age.

loans.use: to buy products such as flour, corn, firewood, and lime

loans.name: Francisco Omar

texts.es:
El señor francisco, es  habitante del municipio de san Rafael del sur, Nicaragua, su actividad comercial es el servicio de transporte de personas de una zona rural de san Rafael del sur que se dedican a la agricultura de productos como maíz, frijoles, tomates y sandia, estas personas tenían que trasladar sus productos en carretones para sacar sus cosechas.

 Sin embargo en vista de la necesidad del transporte, don francisco decide comprar una buseta de segunda, gracias al dinero de muchos años de ahorros. Y así contribuir al mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de los habitantes de su comunidad que carecían de este servicio de trasladar su cosecha al mercado municipal.

Su estado civil es acompañado, y su pareja le ayuda con los gastos del hogar por los ingresos que obtiene por venta de tortillas tostadas y suaves.
texts.en:
Francisco is a resident of the municipality of San Rafael del Sur, Nicaragua.   He has a business transporting people from a rural area of San Rafael del Sur.  These people work in agriculture growing produce such as corn, beans, tomatoes, and watermelons and they needed to transport their goods in trucks to sell their harvests.

However, considering the need for transportation, Francisco has decided to buy a second minibus with the help of the money from many years' savings.  In this way he will contribute to the betterment of the lives of the residents of his community who lacked this transportation service to deliver their harvests to the municipal market.

He is in a relationship and his girlfriend helps him with the household expenses with the income she makes selling toasted and soft tortillas.

loans.use: to buy tires for his minibus

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is married and has four children, for whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. For this reason, six years ago he started his own driving business. Thanks to good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving, and now his children are able to get a good education and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. But his income is not enough to buy all the necessary things for his family. Rashid is asking for a loan of TJS 4,000 to buy furniture, as he does not have modern furniture in his house. As his children become older, they are demanding better living conditions. Also, two of his children are at school and Rashid must buy school supplies for them for the new academic year. In this way, he will have the opportunity to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better education to get ahead. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy furniture and school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various goods, such as plastic shoes, sugar, biscuits, and salt, for resale.

loans.name: Placidie

texts.en: Placidie is 42 years old. She is married to a motorcyclist. With the loan, she wants to buy more shoes to sell. She believes that this business has helped her to improve her standard of living. She plans to use the profits to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Irma Leticia

texts.es: La Sra. Irma de 42 años de edad es casada y tiene un dependiente económico. Ella junto con su esposo tienen  una papelería, negocio con el cual han logrado salir adelante y darle a su hijo lo que ellos consideran mejor para él. Este negocio está en constante crecimiento ya que se encuentra ubicado en uno de los mejores puntos de la ciudad, con el tiempo las necesidades de los clientes han cambiado es por eso que Irma está solicitando de nuestra ayuda para la compra de mercancía, de esta manera podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes ofreciendo más variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Irma is 42 years old and married with one economic dependent. She and her husband have a stationery shop. With this business, they have managed to make a living and give their son what they think is best for him. 

The business is always growing, as it is located in one of the best parts of the city. With time, their customers' needs have changed, and that's why Irma is requesting help with the purchase of merchandise. This way, she will be able to provide better service to the customers, offering them a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi, 37, is a married woman who has seven children between the ages of four and 17 years. She is struggling to ensure that she provides for them. For the past two years, Chizi has been busy in her kiosk, selling goods such as flour and beverages. Her spouse is a farmer and he sells his farm products from home and at the market. Chizi has a desire to educate her children. Her kiosk stock has gone down and she does not have sufficient funds to restock it. She is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of KES 20,000 to buy more stock of maize flour, salt, and other fast-selling goods, such as sweets and juice. She hopes to increase her monthly income and be able to provide quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour, salt, and other fast-selling goods such as sweets and juice.

loans.name: Clesance

texts.en: Clesance is 37 years old. She owns a boutique that she has been running for five years. She wants the loan to buy more maize flour, sugar and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour and beans to sell.

loans.name: Marvin Luis

texts.es:
El Sr. Marvin es comerciante de muebles de madera como roperos, puertas y camas matrimoniales, el aprendió el oficio desde muy joven, comenzó como obrero de un ingenio de azúcar de la zona y después como ayudante en talleres ubicados en san Rafael del sur, y poco a poco fue descubriendo el arte de tallar madera, de tornear y calar dibujos en madera.

Es un ejemplo de perseverancia, de voluntad y deseos de salir adelante como persona, actualmente es un pequeño proveedor de muebles, a personas que se encargan en distribuir estos productos en algunos municipios de Managua, capital de Nicaragua.
Su estado civil es acompañado, tiene tres hijos, dos están en edad escolar, y su hijo mayor es mano derecha en su taller, quien aprendió el oficio de su padre.

El destino del crédito es para la compra de materia prima, para la producción de muebles.
texts.en:
Mr. Marvin sells wood furniture such as: closets, doors, and bed frames.  He learned the trade at a young age, starting out as worker at a local sugar mill and later moving on as an assistant in workshops in South San Rafael and little by little he learned the art of sanding wood, lathing and engraving sketches on the wood.

This is an example of perseverance, willingness, and a desire to get ahead as a person.  He is currently a small furniture provider to people who supply the counties of Managua, capital of Nicaragua.  He is currently in a relationship, has 3 children, two of which are of schooling age, and his oldest is his right hand man in the shop and learning the trade from his father.

The loan will be used to purchase prime materials for the production of furniture.

loans.use: to purchase wood; Spanish Elm, Black Guanacaste

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
La señora Digna de 48 años de edad, es soltera vive con un hijo y su nuera, radica en una colonia de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras. Se dedica desde hace 20 años al negocio de pulpería pues ahí ella vende arroz, maíz, frijoles, frescos, verduras. Sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan.
Doña Digna esta solicitando 21,000.00 para compra de productos como maíz, frescos, detergentes, agua, lácteos, carnes y lo necesario que le hace falta para  atender mejor a sus clientes, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Doña Digna sueña con surtir un poco más su negocio y mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2012.
texts.en:
Digna is 48 years old, she is single and lives with her son and her daughter-in-law in a neighbourhood of the town of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. She has been tending to her general store for twenty years. She sells rice, sweetcorn, broad beans, fizzy drinks, vegetables. Her customers are neighbours and friends; they come every day. Digna asks for a loan of 21,000 lempiras to buy supplies such as sweetcorn, fizzy drinks, detergents, water, dairy products, meat and other necessary items to better answer the needs of her customers. Thanks to this loan, she hopes to increase her income and improve her standard of living. Digna dreams of having a better-stocked shop and of making improvements to her house.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2012.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Oscar Hernán

texts.es: Oscar Hernán de cuarenta y siete años vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, maicillo y sandia, tiene varios años trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y esta muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además posee un buen servicio; Oscar es un hombre luchador, lleno de metas y sueños, él quiere trabajar duro para alcanzar sus objetivos y no piensa darse por vencido, quiere aumentar la producción pero necesita invertir por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, maicillo, abono, herramienta, etc. Oscar Hernán tiene buenas referencias de crédito y asegura poder saldar la deuda además tiene la esperanza de poder darle a su familia una vida plena como se la merecen.
texts.en: Forty-seven-year-old Oscar Hernán lives with his life partner and their children.  He grows corn, sorghum, and watermelons for a living.  He has been working in agriculture for several years and he has gained valuable experience that allows him to produce better harvests.  His cultivated land is in an area that is highly effective for farming and it is very close to his home.  He sells in all the areas surrounding his community and he has a large clientele because people know that everything he sells is of top quality at reasonable prices, plus he offers great customer service.  Oscar is a fighter full of goals and dreams.  He wants to work hard to achieve his goals and he does not plan on giving up.  He wants to increase his yield, but for that he needs to invest, which is why he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy corn and sorghum seed, fertilizer, tools, etc.  Oscar Hernán has good credit references and guarantees he will be able to repay his debt.  He also hopes to be able to give his family the full life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy corn and sorghum seed, fertilizer, and tools

loans.name: Alnjod Group

texts.en:
This group is called Alnjod and is composed of five women. Najod, age 22, is the president of the group. 

She is single and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She would like to remodel her house. On this occasion, she needs a youth loan of YER 50,000 from AMB to buy building materials, such as cement and lumber. She is grateful for the loan and commits to making her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement and lumber, for her house

loans.name: Fifa 2 Group

texts.fr: FIFA 2 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe du nom de Vioutou Delphine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans. Vioutou Delphine est mariée à un peintre du nom de Damien. Vioutou Delphine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés, mais aucun n'est à sa charge. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Vioutou Delphine vend divers fournitures (colle, papiers) dans sa boutique. Vioutou Delphine s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Vioutou Delphine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFA 2, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
FIFA 2 is a group composed of three persons who reside in the same district and who belong to a tontine. The group's representative, Vioutou Delphine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 36 years old and married to a painter named Damien. Vioutou Delphine did not attend school. The couple have three children, all with education but none in their care. 

To cope with her different expenses, Vioutou Delphine sells a variety of supplies (glue, paper) in her shop. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

With the goal of responding better to the requirements of her burgeoning customer base and making more profit, Vioutou Delphine is requesting, along with the other members of the group FIFA 2 , a fourth loan from ALIDé. The first three loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy paint, glue, and paper

loans.name: Prudence 2 Group

texts.en:
Germaine, age 46, is divorced and has five children, aged between 10 and 31 years old. She has three children currently attending school. She also cares for her elderly mother. Germaine is representing the Prudence 2 group. She owns a small business, selling beans and peanuts at a market. She has had this business for more than 20 years! She has gained valuable experience and customer loyalty over the years. She will use the loan to buy more peanuts and beans to sell at her stand. Her business strategy is to sell her products near her clients' homes. 
This is Germaine's first loan with HOPE Congo. Her group members and HOPE are confident she will repay the loan. Her future goal is to open a cement depot.

loans.use: to pay for beans and peanuts.

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en:
Musarat has been doing a business of shoe-making for the past five years. Last year she had low capital because of many problems in receiving payments on time.  She was unable to expand her business activities and she was afraid of taking an informal loan from relatives. She then contacted Kashf foundation upon the suggestion of her neighbor. 

She is a single parent of three daughters and one son. She is an energetic person and eager to support her family. She is responsible for taking care of the basic necessities of her children, including food, health and education. She is also accountable for improving their standard of living. Her children help her in doing this business of shoe-making.

It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation. By the support of Kashf Foundation she is fulfilling her dreams and able to manage her children’s education. Now she requested for a loan of PKR.35,000 to buy additional material for shoes, including leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles, etc. In this way, she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and hence, better support her family.

loans.use: To buy additional material for shoes, including leather, artificial leather and plastic soles, etc.

loans.name: Shoista

texts.en: Shoista is 56 years old and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to progress in life. She is married and has 5 children. One of them is 16 years old and the others are adults. She is one of the successful businesswomen of her town. For more than 15 years she has been busy selling vegetables such as potatoes, onions, and carrots. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop the business and, in this way, improve her living conditions. Her elder son helps her with the business. She wants to develop the business further but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy. She is asking for a loan of 3000tjs to buy goods for developing the business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy vegetables such as onions and potatoes for developing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, underwear, shoes, jeans, hats, belts, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr: Solange est âgée de 30 ans et vit au Bénin. Solange a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Solange est célibataire mais a deux enfants à charge dont un constitue son propre enfant. L’enfant de Solange est scolarisé. Solange vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre à ses divers besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Solange vend du maïs et du charbon de bois de façon secondaire à son domicile et par le système de distribution depuis deux ans. Solange s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère son activité, Solange contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Solange sollicite pour une première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Solange is 30 years old and lives in Benin. She dropped out of secondary school. She is unmarried but has two children to support. One of the children is her own. Her child is in school. Solange lives alone with her children and ensures by herself that the diverse household expenses are covered.

To meet her diverse needs and those of her children, Solange has been selling corn out of her home and via the distribution system for two years. Secondarily, she sells charcoal. She gets her supplies from a region in Benin. Thanks to the revenues her business generates, Solange helps cover the different household expenses. To satisfy the needs of her burgeoning customer base, she is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and charcoal

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in hog-raising and buying scrap for her income. It is a source of joy for her to be of help to her husband, who works as a van driver. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, piglets, and more scrap from her suppliers. Her income helps to make both ends meet, especially for her four school-aged children. This loan will make her planned business sustainable. She hopes to increase her hog-raising business so she can keep her children in school. Any additional profit will be for her family's daily consumption and savings.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets, and more scrap

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a divorced woman with one son, who is her only source of joy and motivates her to work extra hard to provide for him. Being the breadwinner, Mejumaa wakes up early to start her daily activities at her food stall. She has been in this business for the last year, and she dreams of opening a kiosk in the future. Mejumaa’s stall is located at a strategic location, where she has already established a good customer base. Her customers describe her as a kind and caring woman. These characteristics have helped her increase her clientele. Her good service gives her an added advantage.
Mejumaa has requested a loan to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Prudence 3 Group

texts.en:
Aimee, age 42, is married with seven children, ages 4 to 23 years old. She currently has three children attending school. She is representing the group Prudence 3. Aimee sells various food items at a stand in the local market. She will use the loan to buy fish, oil, and 'foufou' which she will sell at her stand. Foufou is a traditional, white, cornmeal-like food in Congo made from the casava plant. Most people eat 'foufou' on a daily basis. Her business strategy is to give friendly and polite customer service to all customers.

This is Aimee's first loan from HOPE Congo. Her group and HOPE are confident she will repay the loan and run her business well. She hopes to be able to travel abroad and buy various food items that are unavailable or rare in Congo.

loans.use: To pay for fish, oil, and 'foufou' (cornmeal-like food).

loans.name: Rosalió Raúl

texts.es:
El Sr. Rosalió es comerciante de muebles de madera como roperos, puertas y camas matrimoniales, el aprendió el oficio de carpintería en una empresa privada que se dedica a la construcción después que sale de la secundaria, debido a un recorte de personal quedo en el desempleo, con su liquidación tiene la idea de comprar herramientas eléctricas y poner su propio negocio personal, local que queda contiguo a su casa de habitación.
Un día de trabajo en su taller empieza a las siete de la mañana, con la distribución de trabajo para sus ayudantes, limpieza del local, selección de la madera, cepillar la madera, tornear la madera, en fin es todo un proceso donde implica arte, paciencia y conocimiento técnico en lo que hace.
El cree que este crédito le ayudara en ampliar y mejorar las condiciones de su actividad comercial.
Su estado civil es acompañado, tiene una niña en edad de pre-escolar,
texts.en:
Rosalió deals in wood furniture, such as wardrobes, doors, and bed frames.  He learned the carpentry trade in a private construction business after finishing secondary school.  He found himself without a job because of personnel cutbacks, but after he was laid off he got the idea to buy electric tools and set up his own business in a space next to his home.

A workday in his shop starts at seven in the morning with assigning work to his assistants, cleaning the shop, selecting the wood, planing it, and lathing it.  Essentially, it is all part of a process that requires artistry, patience, and technical knowledge of what is being done.  

He believes that his loan will help him expand and improve conditions in his business.

He is in a relationship and he has a daughter who is not yet school-age.

loans.use: to buy laurel wood and black earpod tree wood

loans.name: Carlos German

texts.es: El señor Carlos habita actualmente en Masaya, casado tiene dos hijos, labora como Tecnico Quirúrjico en un Hospital  privado, su esposa lo apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que ella tambien labora para un hospital de la capital, juntos  han sacado adelante a sus hijos y actualmente estan luchan por conseguir su sueño que es terminar su casa, con este nuevo credito comprara: Cemento, Hierro, Arena. Agradecido el señor Carlos espera seguir contando con el apoyo de Afodenic quien a travez de Fondos Kivas le estan brindando su confianza.
texts.en:
Carlos currently lives in Masaya. He is married and has two children. He works as a surgical technician in a private hospital. His wife helps him with the household expenses, as she also works for a hospital in the capital. Together, they have provided for their children and now they are struggling to fulfill their dream, which is to finish their house. 

With this new loan, Carlos will buy cement, iron, and sand. Carlos is grateful and hopes to continue counting on the support of Afodenic, who are placing their trust in him through Kiva funds.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials: cement, iron, and sand.

loans.name: Levis

texts.en:
Levis is 21 years old and single, with no dependents.  He provides transport services through his motorbike, a business he started three years ago.   He earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

He has requested a first loan of KES 10,000 to purchase spare parts for servicing his motorbike. The profit he makes will help him repay his loan and save for his future. He dreams of prosperity in the transport business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for servicing his motor bike.

loans.name: Francisco Ernesto
