texts.es: Francisco Ernesto de veintiséis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus padres, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y sorgo, tiene muchos años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento y practica que le permiten obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo es apto para la siembra, muy accesible y con suelo fértil, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; Francisco Ernesto en un hombre admirable, que piensa que la vida es un terreno de batalla, donde hay que luchar hasta conseguir la victoria, en la temporada pasada tuvo algunas perdidas que lo impulsaron ha aumentar la producción, necesita de capital para invertir en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, sorgo, abono, insecticida,  etc.  Francisco tiene bunas referencia y  una moral impecable tiene la certeza que cancela
texts.en: Twenty-six-year-old Francisco Ernesto lives with his life partner and his parents.  He grows corn and sorghum for a living.  He has been working in agriculture for many years and he has acquired a lot of knowledge and experience that allow him to produce better harvests.  His cultivated land is good for planting; it is very accessible and it has fertile soil.  He sells in all of the areas surrounding his community and he has many customers who prefer him because he always has what they need at affordable prices and because he offers good customer service.  Francisco Ernesto is an admirable man who believes that life is a battlefield where one has to fight until victory is achieved.  Last season he suffered some losses that drove him to increase his production.  He needs to invest in supplies, which is why he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy corn and sorghum seed, fertilizer, insecticide, etc.  Francisco has good references and impeccable morals and he is certain he will repay.

loans.use: corn and sorghum seed, fertilizer, insecticide

loans.name: Prudence 4 Group

texts.en:
Jaures, age 37, is married with two children, ages 2 and 11 years old. His 11-year-old is currently attending school. Jaures also provides for his father. 

Jaures is representing the Prudence 4 group. He owns a pharmacy, and has been operating this business for 7 years. He will use the loan to buy more medicine to stock the pharmacy. He carries different over-the-counter drugs for illnesses like malaria, dysentery, flu, and the common cold. 

This is Jaures' first loan with HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. His group and HOPE are confident he will use the loan to benefit his business and repay the loan. Jaures hopes to continue to expand his pharmacy and build a large shop for his business.

loans.use: To pay for medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the maintenance of a citrus orchard

loans.name: Saum

texts.en: Saum is taking out another Kiva loan of 70,000 KES to boost her charcoal selling business. With this loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and to establish a vegetable stall business. Since her previous loan, she has been able to meet her family’s basic needs and to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and bundles of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel owns a sari-sari store (variety store) in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children. Her eldest is 18 and her youngest is 8 years old. Ethel hopes to make a better profit by improving her sari-sari store (general store) business. Her business consists of selling household products like rice, sugar, seasoning, canned goods, chips and other snack foods. The business is the source of her daily income. 

She is requesting a loan to buy additional items or merchandise to sell like rice, sugar, canned goods, sodas and other snack foods. With the loan, Ethel will be able to augment her stocks to attract more customers and  this will give her the chance of increasing her sales.

Ethel hopes to make her business grow and become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, canned goods, sodas and other snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more chickens and bananas to sell

loans.name: Fany Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Sauce es un bello municipio de occidente rodeado de montañas florecidas por la temporada de invierno donde abunda la leche y cuajada que producen sus habitantes.

En él hay muchas personas que se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras y luchadoras como es el caso de Fany del Carmen, una señora de 44 años, casada, madre de una niña en edad escolar, se dedica a laborar como contadora desde hace 20 años, labor que le ha permitido dotar de muchas cosas a su pequeña hija, darle una buena educación y construir su casa con todas las condiciones adecuadas.

Gracias a su profesión y los ingresos de su esposo hoy tienen su propia vivienda la que ha ido mejorando poco a poco con la ayuda de créditos y la que quiere ir ampliando para dejarle un buen patrimonio a su hija.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de medicina y realización de exámenes médicos con el fin de mejorar su salud para ser más eficiente en su trabajo y dedicarle más tiempo a su familia.
 
Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo brindado a través de estos préstamos que le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y espera que en futuro le sigan ayudando.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a beautiful western municipality surrounded by flower-covered mountains in winter where there is plenty of the milk and curd made by its inhabitants.

In this municipality, there are many people who are known for being hard workers, such as Fany del Carmen.  She is 44 years old, married, the mother of a school-age daughter, and she has been an accountant for 20 twenty years.  This work has allowed her to provide her young daughter with many things, to giver her a good education, and to build a house with everything she needs.

Thanks to her job and her husband's income, they now have their own home, which they have been improving little by little with the help of loans.  She wants to continue to add to it to leave her daughter a good inheritance.

She is asking for a loan to buy medicine and to have some medical tests performed in order to improve her health so she will be more efficient and work and so she can spend more time with her family. 

She thanks Kiva and Ceprodel for the help they have given her through these loans, which have helped her improve her family's living conditions, and she hopes that they will continue to help her in the future.

loans.use: to buy medicine and to have medical tests performed

loans.name: Al-Tfaol Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Tfaol and consists of four women. They took out a loan of 200,000 YER.

Yusra is a 30-year-old. She lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a teacher and gets a low salary that is not enough to cover her needs. She is requesting a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to help her cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop. This will enhance her skills in using the computer and speed the process of doing reports for her work which will ensure better conditions for her work.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for personal use

loans.name: Augustino

texts.en:
Augustino  is an old client in his fourth loan cycle and applied for a loan of 3,000,000 shillings to buy dairy cows. He is a retired soldier who is now permanently engaged in agriculture .Augustine is a well-behaved gentleman with a wife and eight children, most of whom are at higher institutions of learning. With this loan, Augustino hopes to expand his business and later buy a vehicle for public transport as a way of diversifying his economic activity. 

Augustino is involved  in the cattle trade and milk and crop husbandry as well. He sells his products to nearby dairy plants and cows are sold to local cattle traders. He is a well-behaved, organised and respected member of the community. Despite all these, he faces challenges of high dependency level because he takes care of many orphans, in addition to competition, dry spells, price fluctuations and limited capital.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Vjollca

texts.en:
Vjollca is in her early thirties and married. Her three children are young and range from six to four years old. She is living in the Ashkali community in Kosovo. They live in a small town under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions. Her family owns a small old house. They have very old windows and doors, which need renovation so the family can live a normal life.

Vjollca's husband provides woodcutting services for heating in his community. Through his work, he tries to generate income for her family. The money he generates through his work is not enough to pay for renovation of windows and doors.

For the first time, Vjollca requests a loan from KosInvest to buy windows and doors for her house repair. After repairing the house, Vjollca will be able to create better living conditions for her family.

She is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for the help!

loans.use: to buy windows and doors for her house repair.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is married and has five children and all go to school. She sells sugar and rice and has been doing this business for the past 18 years. She has decided to request a loan to add more sugar and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 54 years old and a widow with seven children aged between 13 and 26 years old. She purchases and sells various food and drinks like beans, bananas, rice, fanta, juice, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years. She currently employs five people, and she works from 5 a.m to 11 p.m every day per week.

Cecile has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy a large quantity of food and drinks like beans, bananas, rice, fanta, juice, etc. to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of food and drinks like beans, bananas, rice, fanta, juice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 26 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past six years, Priscilla has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells dry beans, maize flour, and sugar. 

To help expand her business, Priscilla has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar, dry beans, and maize flour for resale, and will help Priscilla to generate greater profits and pay for her medical bills. Priscilla hopes that in the future she will be able to own a very big shop. 

Priscilla is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Priscilla who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar, dry beans, and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 43 years old and married.  She lives in Compound #3 along with her six children, 10 to 28 years old.  Three are in school; all of them live at home.

For the past 12 years, Annie has been selling fresh fish.  She likes the way customers respond to her business.  She learned this way of selling from her mother.

Annie is requesting a loan to buy more fresh fish to sell.  In the future, she wants to send her children to higher education (college).

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Fednand

texts.en:
Fednand is from the town of Kaloleni. As head of his household, it is his responsibility to provide for his family. He has been working in commerce for many years. His business is a retail shop where he sells general consumer products.

Fednand works every day, beginning very early in the morning, together with his wife. They are known for their friendliness and for the range of products that their business offers.

Fednand currently needs a loan in order to stock his business with products that his customers are demanding, which, due to a lack of capital, he has not been able to buy. He is requesting a loan from Yehu, with whom he has been working for a number of years and who has supported him in his requests. He is grateful to Yehu because, thanks to its support, he now has the capital he needs to earn a decent living.

This loan will be invested in buying rice, sugar, beans, oil, soap, soda, and flour.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, beans, oil, soap, soda, and flour.

loans.name: Jeton

texts.en:
Jeton is thirty-three years old and married. He has two children, ages two and four years old. They all live in a village not far from a major city. Many families here have taken micro-loans from KosInvest to start up businesses or improve their living conditions, Jeton being one of them. 

Jeton has been working in the livestock business for a long time. He has a cow and he provides milk and milk products for his family and in this way he reduces their living costs. Every time he has tried to put some money aside to buy another cow,  something else has always come up that was urgent. He needs a loan to buy another milk cow and to build a new stable in hopes of increasing the dairy production and of course, the earnings from selling dairy products to the locals.

During the autumn and winter time, Jeton also sells coal for heating in his community in order to increase family’s income.

He says that he plans to invest more in the livestock business and to increase the number of cows he keeps. In this way he will improve the welfare of his children. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he is grateful to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Al-Hrmin Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Hrmin and consists of four women who are hardworking and live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 200,000 YER.

Hadil is a 25-year-old, single woman. She lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She works  in embroidery from her own home and sells her products to her family, friends, and neighbors. She has a house and she would like to build on a room so she applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy building materials like cement, etc. for building her room.

loans.use: to buy  cement, etc. for building her room.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is 32 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal, in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. 

For the past year, Tadeo has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells dry beans, maize flour, and sugar . 

To help expand his business, Tadeo has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar, dry beans, and maize flour for resale.  It will help Tadeo to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Tadeo hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another shop. 

Tadeo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Tadeo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more commodities like sugar, dry beans, and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 32 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal, in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, with three of them currently in school. 

For the past five years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks, like soda and beer. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beers and soda for resale.  It will help Agnes to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. 

Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to rent a big room that will be used only to sell drinks, like beers and soda. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Agnes who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more beers and soda for resale.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en:
Brigitte, a 30-year-old married mother of three children between the ages of two and seven, buys and sells various goods such as tomatoes, aubergine etc. In this business for 12 years, she works from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day of the week.

Brigitte has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale. With the profits, she will be able to save for her future and pay the children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as tomatoes and aubergine for resale.

loans.name: Mukasa

texts.en:
Adam is an old client in his third loan cycle. He runs a retail shop on the outskirts of Kyotera town. He has a permanent home in the same area. Adam is a married man with two children.

The purpose of this loan is to buy more stock, most preferably sugar, which has high demand and high interest margin. Adam is an honest man and that is why he has captured the market in the whole area. He is always helped by his wife, who is equally experienced in this, as he ventures into other income-generating projects like buying and selling cows and monitoring his boys, who ride his motorcycles for public hire and transport.

Adam says his biggest problem is customers who want to buy on credit all the time and refuse to pay back in the end. However, with experience, he has managed to handle them now and hopes that this loan will automatically expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his retail shop.

loans.name: Emilson Alexander

texts.es: Emilson, tiene 34 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos, vive con su familia en una colonia que pertenece al sector de la Lima Cortes. Emilson anteriormente se dedicaba a transportar estudiantes en un busito, pero por necesidad de obtener otros ingresos, hace tres meses decidió establecer una pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar y el busito lo tiene alquilado a otra persona quien transporta los estudiantes, y el junto a su esposa atender la pulpería, está vendiendo granos básicos, azúcar, huevos, churros, dulces, cereales, pan, galletas, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza, artículos del hogar etc. Esta solicitando a ODEF el tercer préstamo que es por 15,000 Lempiras para invertirlo en surtir la pulpería de productos alimenticios, de limpieza y artículos del hogar. Este préstamo le ayudara a ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes. Su sueño es convertir el negocio en algo duradero y prospero para poder ayudar a su familia. Esta muy contento por los financiemientos porque le han ayudado mucho a obtener siempre los ingresos familiares, es una persona muy responsable con sus deudas, el prestamo anterior que le financio Kiva lo cancelo puntualmente.
texts.en: Emilson, 34, is married and has 3 children.  He lives with his family in a neighborhood of La Lima Cortes.  Previously, Emilson was working as a school bus driver, but because he needed to earn more income he started up a grocery store 3 months ago where he sells basic consumer products.  He now rents his bus to another person who transports the students, and he and his wife tend to the store.  He is selling staple grains, sugar, eggs, churros, sweets, cereals, bread, cookies, canned goods, cleaning products, home products, etc.  He is requesting his 3rd loan from ODEF for 15,000 Honduran lempiras to buy food products, cleaning products and home goods for his store.  With this loan, he will be able to offer a variety of products to his customers.  His dream is to make his business long-lasting and prosperous so that he can help his family.  He is very pleased with the loans, because they have helped him a lot to obtain an income for his family.  He is a person who is very responsible with his debts; he paid off his previous Kiva loan on time.

loans.use: to buy products for his store, including: staple grains, dairy products, flour, butter, eggs, cleaning products, products for the home, and other items

loans.name: Mont Sinai Plus Group

texts.en:
Alphonse is the leader of the Community Bank named “Mont Sinaï Plus.” It is composed of six members, united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Alphonse is 58 years old and the father of five children whose ages vary between 18 and 31 years old. He has been active in his business since 1998. He sells sewing items in western area of Kinshasa. He has already borrowed fourteen loans from MFI HOPE DRC for business expansion and fully repaid them. Thanks to Hope’s loans, his business has prospered and it generates a profit of US$150 per week.

 Alphonse intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of his business by buying some more sewing items in bulk to resell at profit and increase his income. His ambition is to diversify his business by opening a beverage facility in his environment. He works hard in order to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to increase his stock by buying some sewing items in bulk

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Anthony is a resident of the city of Mombasa. He is 30 years old and single. 

He is involved in managing a motorcycle taxi business. He has been in this business for two months. In addition, he has a vegetable stall selling a variety of fruits and vegetables. He also breeds poultry and does vegetable farming. 

Anthony would like to conduct some irrigation. He is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a water pump and pipes. This will enable him to increase his production and supplies.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump and pipes for irrigation.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the town of Kaloleni in the coastal region of Kenya. She is married and has one child, who is currently in school. 

For the past two years, Mary has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells household items and foodstuffs. In addition, she has a barber shop, where she has hired one gentleman.

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings from Yehu. The loan will be used to buy flour and other small, fast-selling goods to sell in her shop and a shaving machine for her barber shop.  This will help Mary generate greater profits and narrow her capital gap. 

She hopes that in the future she will be able to have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy flour and other small, fast-selling goods and a shaving machine

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu has a grocery store in her house where she sells all types of basic consumer products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, etc. She also sells some stationery goods. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m., at times staying open even later. Her children and husband help her with her work when they aren't too busy. She has had this business for more than four years, having started it from savings derived from her previous job, and ever since has been gradually improving it with loans.

Mwanatumu will use this loan to stock her store with more rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, sausages and other consumer staples. She has been with Yehu Microfinance for more than a year, and she likes it because she has made friends in the group.

Mwanatumu's goals are to continue to make progress with her business, and to see her store grow over time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, sausages and other consumer staples.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
El municipio de El Sauce se caracteriza por ser un pueblo calmo, lleno de personas trabajadoras y honradas como es el caso de doña Amparo que habita en la comarca Las Pilas a 8 km de dicho municipio, es una señora de 42 años, casada con tres hijos de los cuales solo tiene una a su cargo quien está en edad escolar.

Inició su negocio hace 18 años, el cual consiste en la venta de ropa nueva variada tanto para damas como para caballeros y cerdos, lo que son los cerdos los adquiere de tamaño pequeño para luego engordarlos y venderlos en pie a comerciantes que destazan estos animales para luego vender la carne.
Gracias a este negocio hoy tiene su propia vivienda donde habita con su familia y el que le permite ayudar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Está solicitando este crédito para compra de ropa nueva variada y cerdos para su respectiva comercialización con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y así generar un poco más de ganancia lo cual es un beneficio para el desarrollo económico de su hogar.

Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo con estos pequeños créditos que ayudan a mejorar las condiciones de vida de muchas familias de escasos recursos y que sin ello no se pudieran cumplir muchos sueños.
texts.en:
The municipality of El Sauce is characterized as a calm town, full of hard-working and honorable people such as Amparo who lives in the region of Las Pilas 8k away from said municipality. She is a 42-year-old married woman with three children of which only one is still a dependant of school age.

She started her business 18 years ago. It consists of selling a variety of new clothes for men and women and fattening pigs. Regarding the pigs, she acquires them when they are small in order to later fatten them up and sell them on foot to traders that quarter these animals to later sell the meat.

Thanks to this business, today she has her own home where she lives with her family, and she is able to help her husband cover the household expenses.
She is requesting this loan to buy a variety of new clothing and pigs for their respective sale, with the aim of satisfying her customer demand, and in this way, generate a little more profit, which is beneficial for the financial development of her household. 

She thanks KIVA and Ceprodel for the support through these small loans that help to improve the living standard of many low-income families who without which would not be able to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy new clothing and pigs to be butchered.

loans.name: Faki

texts.en:
Faki is 25 years old and single. He established a grinding machine business in the last two years. Faki is serving his rural community. 

His business has grown since he became a client of Yehu because he has been trained in business management. Faki dreams of expanding his business in the future and opening a retail shop. 

He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to service his machine.

loans.use: to service his grinding machine.

loans.name: Swayifi

texts.en:
Swayifi is an old client from lwengo dealing in retail of general merchandise. He is a married man with a family of four children.

Swayifi applied for a loan of 2,300,000 shillings only, which was granted, and he hopes to restock his shop so that he can increase his turnover and profit margin as well. 

He also deals in dry produce so as to diversify his business. He says this trade is equally profitable, though seasonal. Swayifi's customers are the local people and primary school pupils just adjacent to his shop. His business faces challenges of poor means of transport, as roads are in a very poor state, so transport costs are expensive. 

He describes himself as a creative, reliable, and hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise for his retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kaloleni and at 43 years old, she sells groceries in her vegetable stall. She is a married mother of six children. She began this business last year, after getting a working capital from her husband. Currently her children help her in the business on the weekends and when there are important games.

She offers a variety of vegetables and fruits. With this loan she will buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages, etc. She hopes to progress more in the future to bring her children all of the help that they need.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages, etc.

loans.name: C 80551 Abizera Group

texts.en:
Xaveline is 40 years old and is married with four children between the ages 3 and 17 years old. Xaveline is the president of a group called “C 80551 Abizera” and is the first on the left side. Xaveline owns a small general store selling different kinds of foods like cassava flour, bread, rice, bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, etc. Her business is open from 6 am until 4 pm every day. This is her 12th successful year in her business. 

Xaveline and her group will use this loan to purchase more products such as salt, cassava flour, bread, Irish potatoes, tomatoes and so on. Xaveline has many plans for the profits that they hope to  make from this loan. She would like to provide food for her family, pay school fees for her children, and renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more salt, cassava flour, bread, rice, bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy large quantities of food like bananas, potatoes, rice, and maize for resale.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married woman. She has 7 children, all attending school. She describes herself as a talkative and social woman. 

Kanze operates a business selling charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. She also sells dumplings during the mornings hours before conducting her charcoal business, selling door to door. Her business is located within a busy town and her primary customers are local residents from the environs. Her biggest business challenge is the high cost of transport. 

Kanze will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale. Her business goal is to own a shop. She hopes that in the future, she will be a financially stable woman.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Nohemy Yovany

texts.es:
Nohemy, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con su hijo y su abuela en el municipio de San Francisco, Atlántida.
Ella tiene más de 6 años de haber establecido su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, pastillas, confites, refrescos, productos de limpieza, churros, condimentos, etc., y adicionalmente vende sandalias y otra mercadería que le solicitan los clientes. Nohemy ha mantenido estable este negocio mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente está solicitando el sexto préstamo, con el cual quiere surtir mas su negocio comprando maíz, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, manteca, huevos, carnes y otros. Con esta inversión va poder ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes. Su meta es trabajar muy duro para ayudar a su hijo a que se gradúe.
texts.en:
Nohemy, age 37, is a single mother.  She lives with her son and her grandmother in the San Francisco municipality of Atlántida.

She established her own business, a grocery store, over six years ago.  She sells food products like rice, beans, sugar, lard, candy, preserves, soft drinks, cleaning products, churros, and condiments, etc.  She also sells sandals and other merchandise that her customers request.

Nohemy has kept this business stable with the investment of various loans.  She is currently requesting her sixth loan.  She wants to use the loan to stock her business more.  She will buy corn, beans, sugar, rice, lard, eggs, meat, and other products.  With this investment she will be able to offer her customers a variety of products.

Her goal is to work very hard in order to help her son graduate.

loans.use: to buy food products like corn, beans, sugar, coffee, and others in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is an old client of this institution. He applied for a loan of three million Ugandan shillings to buy cattle that he will graze for a short time and then sell.

Nathan has a big piece of land, which helps him to keep many cows.  The area is famous for cattle keeping, the main source of his income.  He has been in cattle keeping since 1994. He has done this together with the help of his wife and sons, whom he has moulded to learn business skills. 

Nathan started this business in order to better his standard of living and to put his siblings through school.  Nathan's customers come from Kampala, Kasensero. His main challenges are competition, limited capital, and long dry spells.

loans.use: To buy cattle to graze and sell.

loans.name: Marco

texts.en:
Marco is a Peruvian artisan specializing in steel art, including sculptures and home décor. To continue production, Marco would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of steel, as well as the varnish he uses to prepare the steel prior to sculpting.

Marco has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

"From the time I was a boy, I was inclined toward design. As a teenager, I studied maintenance mechanics and what I learned there enabled me to work and to depict my own ideas in metal. My specialty is working in cold metal. I try to make the most of materials that others usually discard. Nothing is junk – I can use everything. I like to put aero-spatial details into my work, and I also like to use Inca iconography. I want my work to be different, distinct from what you'd usually find."

"I would like to thank you all for supporting my art through this microcredit. This is a great motivation to continue developing new designs that offer a captivating touch in your home."

Use the link below to view Marco's sculptures and home décor on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5760

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of steel and varnish for his sculptures.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 27. She is married and has three children. The oldest attends school. She has been selling different items in the business and she wants to upgrade her business through adding more items from the requested loan, buying such things as cooking oil, rice and sugar to sell. With the profits from the business, she plans to build her home.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is married and has five children, who are enrolled in school. She is married to a security guard. 

She sells shoes and has been in the business for eight years. With the loan, she wants to buy more shoes to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to build a house, because she is tired of renting.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud is 39 years old and married. He has two children and tries to do his best for them. He sells food products such as candy, biscuits, coffee, canned foods, and others to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years. Through the financial support from his father, he has managed to grow his business. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming prosperous in the future. 

Mahmud needs a loan to of 3000 USD to buy goods to expand his assortment. Also, he wants to repair his shop. In this way he will attract more customers and from his profit, he will improve his living conditions. He hopes for your help.

loans.use: To buy food products and to repair his shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy underwear for resale

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose has three children and all are enrolled in school. She sells fish. With the loan; she plans to buy more fish to sell. She has been selling fish for the past eight years. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Komang

texts.en:
Komang is a jewelry artisan from Bali who specializes in silver and gemstone jewelry. To continue production, he would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as sterling silver and natural gemstones.

Komang has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"I was born in Celuk, renowned as the birthplace of silversmiths. When I was 10 years old, my parents, who are master silversmiths, told me to learn about making jewelry because someday, when I got older, I'd be able to make a living from this skill. I enjoyed creating new designs for my parents. I like drawing and I came up with a variety of jewelry designs. I even earned some money with this. I love this job! The nicest part of my jewelry is the uniqueness of its style. Although it shows an ethnic influence, it's different from other Balinese jewelry."

"I want to say thanks to all of you for supporting my work through this microcredit. I still have to prepare more stock, and I need a bit of support for this so I can buy materials. I hope that this opportunity will allow me to continue growing."

Use the link below to view Komang's jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=8459

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as sterling silver and natural gemstones

loans.name: Karina Mercedes

texts.en:
Karina is an artisan in Guatemala who specializes in leather handbags featuring traditional weavings. To continue production she would like to invest in the purchase of quality leather as well as hand-loomed textiles.

Karina has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"I was born in the capital, but I lived for nine years in the picturesque village of Amatitlan. At college, I'd spend vacations creating clothing collections based on our beautiful handwoven 'jaspe' fabric. Today my leather handbags feature insets of the beautiful brocades woven by Maya women on backstrap looms for 'huipil' blouses. Their weaving motifs date back more than 1,200 years."

"I have always loved the traditional 'huipiles' (blouses and dresses) that women wear in Guatemala, and so I looked for a way to promote their art and work closely with them. I want to thank you for your support and trust, especially through this microcredit. It will help generate more work and income for me and for many women in the community for the next several months."

Use the link below to view Karina's handbags on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=8299

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as quality leather and hand-loomed textiles

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, a 33-year-old married mother of five children, lives in Carangan, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. For more than two years, she has made a living by operating a retail store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mary Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Jackilou

texts.en: Jackilou is married and the mother of three dependent children. She is 27 years old and lives in the village of Bañadero in Ozamis City in the province of Misamis Occidental. Jackilou repairs furniture such as chairs and tables to earn a living, and she has had this business for 10 years. She earns 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase materials for furniture repair. Jackilou joined GDMPC in 2008. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for furniture repair.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby is married and the mother of three children. She is 44 years old and lives in the village of Dela Paz in the municipality of Clarin in Misamis Occidental Province. Ruby makes and sells suman (rice cakes) to earn a living, and she has had this business for 10 years. She earns 4,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make suman. Ruby is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make suman.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is 61 years old and lives in Masabud, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her husband and three children. To make a living, Angelina owns and operates a retail store. She has been in this line of work for 13 years and earns PHP 5,000 a month. In 2008, Angelina joined Kiva partner GDMPC, and is now applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 which she will use to buy more items to sell to her customers. She hopes to earn additional profits from her the business so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Edy Gregorio

texts.es: Eddy es chofer profesional porque así lo acredita su licencia de conducir y lo respalda su experiencia ya que tiene 5 años manejando un carro de su propiedad con el cual ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Siempre le ha gustado conducir y se propuso este nuevo negocio cuando dejo de trabajar y pudo dar la entrada para la compra de un carro. Como no se encuentra afiliado a ninguna cooperativa su mayor temor es que lo detengan y su vehiculo pase tiempo detenido, es po tal motivo que prefiere manejar el mismo, tambien por que terceras personas no lo cuida igual y tienden a dañarlos. Con el préstamo va a darle mantenimiento a su carro así como comprarle llantas y una cadena, espera conseguirlo ya que si necesita hacerle una revisión por que con el paso del tiempo se van deteriorando. Está casado por más de 15 años y sus hijos estudian en la escuela fiscal. Su sueño es poder comprar dos carros mas para poder fundar una cooperativa.
texts.en: Edy is a professional chauffeur because his driver's license authorizes it and his experience backs it up, since he has been driving his own car for five years and has been able to carry his family forward this way. He has always liked to drive and he started this business when he stopped working and could pay a deposit on a car. Since he is not affiliated with any cooperative, his worst fear is that they will stop him, and his vehicle will spend time detained. It's for this reason that he prefers to drive himself, as well as because other people don't care for the cars as well and tend to damage them. With the loan, he will do maintenance on his car as well as buy tires and a chain. He hopes to get it since he needs to do a check, because with time they are deteriorating. He has been married for more than 15 years and his children study at the state school. His dream is to be able to buy two more cars in order to found his own cooperative.

loans.use: to afford tires, a chain, and maintanance.

loans.name: Freyson Roberto

texts.es:
Freyson Roberto es un joven de 25 años Sauceño de corazón, nacido y criado en este bello pueblo con principios religiosos y costumbres tradicionales a nuestro país.
Estudió la carrera de Ingeniería Forestal y se graduó muy joven porque siempre ha sido muy aplicado en sus estudios y su vida personal. Su objetivo era encontrar trabajo para ser un joven independiente y ayudar a sus padres en lo que pudiera.

Hoy en la actualidad tiene dos años de haber encontrado un excelente trabajo acorde a su profesión donde se siente muy feliz de ejercer lo que tanto le gusta y además porque genera sus propios ingresos.
 
Uno de sus mayores sueños es formar su familia y llegar a tener dos hijos a los cuales les quiere dar lo mejor de él en cuanto a amor y estabilidad económica y hoy que ha encontrado la mujer ideal para él para formar un hogar con ella quiere formalizarse, casándose de la forma religiosa y legal, por tal motivo está solicitando este crédito para llevar a cabo todo lo relacionado con los gastos de este matrimonio.

Se siente muy agradecido y satisfecho con KIVA y Ceprodel por su buena, eficiente y rápida atención en el otorgamiento de estos créditos que le ayudan a las personas de escasos recursos y quieren cumplir sus sueños en la vida.
texts.en:
Freyson Roberto is a young man of 25 years of age, with the heart of a Sauceño, born and raised in this beautiful town, with religious principles and traditional customs of our country.

He studied forestry and graduated very young because he always has been very industrious in his studies and his personal life. His objective was to find work in order to be an independent young man and to help his parents however he could. 

It now has been two years since he found an excellent job in his profession where he feels very happy to practice what he enjoys so much and also because he earns his own income.

One of his biggest dreams is to start a family and to have two children for whom he would give his best of love and financial stability and now he has found the ideal woman for him to create a home and she wants a formal ceremony, to marry religiously and formally, and this is why he is asking for this loan in order to pay for the marriage expenses.

He feels very grateful and satisfied with Kiva and Ceprodel for the good, efficient, and fast service granting these loans that help people with scarce resources who want to fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: to pay for matrimonial expenses

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, has been raising pigs for 20 years and earns 12,570 PHP per month. She’s 39 years old now, yet she continues to hang on with her piggery livelihood to provide an adequate life for her three children. 

She became a member of GDMPC in 2012. In order to enhance her livestock for selling, she is borrowing 10,300 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase feeding supplies. 

Sarah hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Vinancia

texts.en: Vinancia is 47 years old, married and the mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who earns a living by selling native delicacies in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy ingredients to make more food items to sell to her customers. She has been in this line of work for seven years and would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make delicacies popular in the Philippines.

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en:
Ngin, age 59, is married and has three children, two of whom are attending school. Ngin is a hardworking man who owns and manages one and a half hectares of farmland to generate his major source of income. He has been cultivating rice for over 30 years with his wife, and he is an expert in his farming practices. Ngin plans to increase the volume of his rice production by purchasing extra farmland in the next few years, as he tries hard to achieve his three-year goal.

Ngin would like to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase fertilizer and insecticide for his crops. Through his patience and hard work, he believes that he can better his income and provide a good living standard for his family. Moreover, he aims to keep supporting and offering good opportunities for education to his two school-age children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide for his crops.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren lives in Pantaon, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. For 10 years, he has earned money through providing transportation services so as to support the needs of his three children. He earns an income of 5,000 PHP a month in this business.  

Without hesitation, Efren is borrowing 8,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair the transport vehicle used in his business and provide his children with a better education. For a 39-year-old father, there’s nothing that can make him happier than to see his children successful in their studies.

Efren joined GDMPC in 2008. His plan for the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to repair the transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Jenevive

texts.en: Jenevive is 36 years old and lives in Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental with her husband and three children. For the last nine years, she has made a living by farming a plot of land that she owns. She earns PHP 11,000 a month, and is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer. She joined GDMPC last year and plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a single man, aged 49, who operates a small junkshop. He has bought and resold junk for almost nine years now. He finished only high school and has a disability in his left arm, which is why he finds it hard to find better employment and pursues this kind of business. His income provides his family's sustenance for meals and basic kitchen needs. 

He is now asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more plastics, empty cans and bottles to resell for profits. Someday, with enough funds, he hopes to start up a small store for additional income and to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more plastics, empty cans and bottles to resell for profits

loans.name: Val

texts.en: Val and his wife earn a living by managing a talipapa (or fruit and vegetable stall). They have been in this line of work for almost seven years, and this is their sole source of income. They earn about PHP 9,000 a month, which they use to care for their five children and keep them enrolled in school. Val would like to improve his small business so that he and his wife can continue to educate their children. He is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy more fish and vegetables (cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes and beans) to sell to his customers. This will allow him to increase his family's income and provide their customers with better service.

loans.use: to buy fish and vegetables to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun, age 28, is a farmer living in Kampot province with her spouse and two school-age children. Rice farming has been the primary source of her income for a long time. With her income, Sun can pay for food and products for household use, allowances for her children and other costs. With her perseverance, Sun plans to educate her two children up to college, because she wants to see them become professionals one day. 

Sun would like to renovate her present house to provide her family with more comfortable conditions. Consequently, she is asking for a loan of $1,000 US to add to her savings to concrete the ground floor and lift her wooden house a bit higher from the land. She is very glad for the consistent support from Kiva lenders. She hopes that she and her family will have suitable living conditions with this help.

loans.use: to concrete the ground floor and lift her wooden house a bit higher from the land.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is a fish vendor from the municipality of Talibon in Bohol Province. She is married and has three children – ages 4, 7, and 9. Her husband is a fisherman who works hard for his family by fishing in the evening. Ma. Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net for her husband and for additional capital to buy more fish to sell.

Ma. Lourdes tries her best to earn a living to support the needs of her family. Her business provides her with the income that she needs for food, clothing, and the education of her children. In the future, she would like to have a bigger place where she can sell her fish.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Del Rocio

texts.es: Sandra es una madre de familia emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante. En su domicilio hace varios años atrás, inicio su pequeña tienda por la necesidad de ayudar económicamente a su esposo pues su trabajo como agricultor paso por momentos críticos y no ganaba lo necesario para cubrir sus deudas, se le ocurrió la tienda porque parte de los productos ellos los cultivan ya que viven en Milagros una tierra muy fértil, a eso le suma la necesidad de no querer dejar a sus hijos al cuidado de otra persona. El negocio abre todos los días y lo atiende con la ayuda de sus hijos. En su tienda oferta víveres, granos, azúcar, enlatados y demás. Con el préstamo espera poder comprar mercadería para así poder mejorar sus ventas y al obtener los resultados que espera poder pagar puntual el crédito y terminar de construir su casa la cual es de caña pero no cuenta con los servicio básicos.
texts.en:
Sandra is an entrepreneurial mother of a family and eager to get ahead. In her home, several years ago, she began her little store because of the necessity of helping her husband financially since in his work as a farmer, going through difficult times, he was not earning enough to cover their expenses. 

The store came about in order to sell some of the products they grow in Milagros, a very fertile land, and in addition to this she does not need to leave her children under the care of someone else. Her business is open every day and she takes care of it with the help of her children. In her store she offers groceries, grains, sugar, canned items and more. 

With the loan she wants to be able to buy merchandise in order to improve sales and as a result she hopes to be able to pay her loan on time and finish building her house which is made of cane but does not have basic services.

loans.use: to buy groceries, grains, sugar, and canned items

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza is a hard-working and determined woman who is not married yet. She is 24 years old and lives with her parents. They love her very much and want to help her launch a business in animal husbandry. She has some experience in this field because many of her friends and neighbors make a living this way. Little by little with the passing of the time year she has perfected her knowledge, including plans to sell her animals in the local market. She will be a very good businesswoman because she is so industrious, and will get help from her mother. Shahnoza has also completed a course for women on how to succeed in business. She is requesting a loan for TJS 1,000 to buy young cattle, which she will raise carefully and well so that she can earn a good income. She is committed to repay this loan on time, and is grateful for help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy cattle for a new animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a loving woman. She is 52 years old and had five children. She raises hogs and sells them for profit. She continued in the business while her children were still studying. Now, they are employed and sometimes help her financially. She doesn't want to rely on their remittances, and this is why she still pursues her business. She is now borrowing 30,000 PHP to buy vaccines, feed, and medicine to sustain her hogs. Aside from raising hogs, she also raises chickens and will buy feed for them, too.

With hard work and the help of her children, Maria hopes to achieve economic stability someday.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feed, and medicine to sustain her hogs.

loans.name: Jaqueline María

texts.es:
El Jicaral es un municipio que pertenece al departamento de León, en él habita Jaqueline María, una joven profesora de 23 años, soltera, con muchos deseos de superación que estudia Ciencias de la Educación con el fin de tener un mejor nivel social y por ende un mejor desarrollo económico.

Como toda joven con sueños para el futuro desea llegar a ser una excelente profesional, tener su propia vivienda y una familia estable.

Está solicitando un crédito para pagar los aranceles de la universidad con el objetivo de no tener ningún inconveniente para llegar a obtener su título universitario.

Está muy agradecida con KIVA y Ceprodel por este período que tiene de trabajar con ellos y que le han brindado su mano amiga con el apoyo de estos créditos que aseguran el futuro de las personas que más lo necesitan.
texts.en:
El Jicaral is a municipality of the León department, where Jaqueline María lives. She is a young 23 year-old teacher who is single and has great dreams of self-improvement. She studies Education Sciences with the goal of having a better social standing and better economic development. 

Like all young people with dreams for the future, she hopes to become a great professional and to have her own home and a stable family.

She is requesting a loan to pay university fees. Her objective is to not let anything get in the way of obtaining her university degree.

She is very grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL for the time she has been working with them and because they have offered a helping hand, through the support of these loans, to assure the future for people who need it most.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay workers

loans.name: Sitoramo

texts.en:
Sitoramo, a 46-year-old single woman, has decided to begin an animal husbandry business. Hardworking and in possession of a business certificate, she is requesting a loan of 2500tjs to buy some cows to raise for sale. Sitoramo will be assisted in this enterprise by her father, with whom she resides.

This venture will enable her to improve the family's living conditions, and she promises to make her payments on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Houévo Ida

texts.fr: Houévo Ida vit au Bénin et est mariée à un électricien du nom de Cyrille. Houévo Ida n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais a appris la couture. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Houévo Ida vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Houévo Ida exerce depuis dix huit ans, la couture dans son atelier. Parallèlement à cette activité principale, Houévo Ida vend des articles de mercerie. Houévo Ida s’approvisionne dans certaines villes du Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Houévo Ida contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Houévo Ida sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Houévo Ida lives in Benin and is married to an electrician named Cyrille. She did not attend school but learned how to sew. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. Houévo Ida lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

To meet her needs and those of her children, Houévo Ida has been sewing in her workshop for eighteen years. Parallel to this main business, she sells sewing supplies. She gets her supplies from certain cities in Benin. Thanks to the revenues that this business generates. she is helping with the different family expenses. 

To satisfy the needs of her burgeoning customer base, Houévo Ida is requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia con su anterior credikiva, compró  mercancia cosmética, calzado sobre medida ropa y logró satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y aumentar su volumen de ventas. Ella se encuentra muy contenta porque para el mes del amor y de la amistad han solicitado nuevos pedidos y necesita preparase para esa temporada comprando productos juveniles como perfumes, accesorios , calzado y ropa informal. Con su inversión de credikiva Alicia planea aumentar sus utilidades en este segundo semestre época en la que comercialmente es muy efectiva en el repunte de las ventas. Su mensaje a los finaciadoresde Kiva es el siguiente: " Muchos agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, deseo que sigan apoyandonos, para continuar progresando con mi negocio.
texts.en: Alicia with her previous Kiva loan, bought merchandise including cosmetics, orthotic shoes, and clothing satisfying the needs of her customers and increasing her sales. She is very happy because for the month of Love and Friendship (holiday celebrated in September) they have new orders and she needs to prepare for that season buying products for youth such as perfumes, accessories, footwear and casual clothing. With the proceeds of the Kiva loan Alicia plans to increase her profits in this second half of the season which is commercially very effective in sales recovery. Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following: “Many thanks to Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, I hope that they continue to help us, in order to continue making progress in my business."

loans.use: to buy perfumes, accessories, shoes, and casual clothing

loans.name: Gulangez

texts.en:
Gulangez is a hardworking 19-year-old with a great desire to progress in life. Single and living with her parents, whose income is not enough to improve their living conditions, Gulangez has decided to start a new business selling food products in the local market. She will be one of the successful business women of her town, and she will be helped in the enterprise by her parents.

Her experience, skills and the business course she took will help Gulangez to organize and develop the venture, and she is requesting her first loan from MLO to begin it. She feels deeply grateful to KIVA and all lenders who will help and support her. Please, help her if possible.

loans.use: to buy bread, sugar and other food products for her new business.

loans.name: Elsy Carolina

texts.es: Elsy tiene 46 años y vive en el Fortín, sector en el cual se están empezando a ver obras por parte del gobierno ya que la mayoría de sus calles no están pavimentadas por lo que no tienen servicios básicos. Es aquí donde con mucho esfuerzo compro una vitrina pequeña y empezó a comprar artículos de papelería como cuadernos, gomas, laminas, cartulinas etc. con el tiempo y cuando se hizo más conocida empezó a surtir y brindar otros servicios como copias, escaneos y trabajos en computación. El negocio como no es muy grande lo maneja sola desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, como sus hijos son mayores de edad a veces le ayudan con el negocio. Con el préstamo que va a solicitar espera poder comprar otra vitrina y mas mercadería para poder aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Elsy is forty-six years old, she lives at el Fortín, area in which the government is starting to do a lot of work, since most of the streets are not paved, reason why they don't have the basic services. This is where, with a lot of effort, she bought a small display cabinet, and started selling stationery items such as notebooks, erasers, sheets of paper, cards, etc. Over time, and when she became better known, she began providing other services such as making copies, scanning papers and computer related work. Since the business isn't very big, she runs it on her own since 7 am until 10 pm, because her eldest children who are of legal age, help her sometimes. With the requested loan she will buy an additional display cabinet and more merchandise to be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, erasers, sheets of paper and cards

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy milk and pots

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is married and 38 years of age. She does decorative embroidery and sewing for her neighboring clients to financially support her family. She is very creative in her work and receives regular orders every month.

Her husband sells different agricultural products such as wheat, rice etc. Nusrat has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy rice and wheat in bulk quantity to be able to fulfill larger orders on time. He is very experienced in his work and Nusrat is confident that his business will be expanded further after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy wheat and rice to sell

loans.name: Minandégo

texts.fr: Minandégo est âgé de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Minandégo est marié à une marchande du nom de Victorine. Minandégo n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Minandégo a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à sa charge. Minandégo assure ensemble avec sa femme les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Minandégo a appris la vulcanisation, activité qu’il exerce depuis une dizaine d’années et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Parallèlement à cette activité, Minandégo vend des chambres à air dans sa région. Minandégo s’approvisionne dans sa région. Grâce au revenu que lui génèrent ses activités, Minandégo contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Minandégo sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Minandégo ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Minandégo is 32 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a merchant named Victorine. He did not attend school. He has three children, not all in school but all in his care. Along with his wife, he ensures that the diverse household expenses are covered.

To help meet the diverse needs of the family, he learned how to fix tires. He has been in this business for about ten years. It brings in significant revenues. Parallel to this business, he sells inner tubes in his region. He gets his supplies in his region. Thanks to the revenues that his business generates, he helps with the different family expenses. 

To satisfy his burgeoning customer base, Minandégo is requesting a loan from ALIDé for a third time. The loans received previously by him were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy inner tubes, tires, and battery acid.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en: Ma. Magdalena is married to an army officer and they have five children. She operates a hog raising business since she doesn't want to rely on her spouse's remittance as her income. Ma. Magdalena earns about PHP 3,000 for each hog she sells. She is currently feeding two hogs and asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy medicines, vaccines and hog feed to provide enough sustenance to help grow healthier hogs. This will also lead to a higher income for Ma. Magdalena. Someday, she hopes to keep growing as a successful hog raiser and to uplift her family from their poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy medicines, vaccines and hog feed

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 32 years old, is a single mother of one child, aged 12 years. She has been running a food stall business for 12 years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. Mary will use this loan to purchase cereals, cooking oil and sugar. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child.

Mary has a good credit history with KADET and this is her third loan. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and to provide quality education to her child.

loans.use: to buy cereals, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay workers

loans.name: Shukrona

texts.en:
Shukrona is 27 year old. She is a divorcee with no children. She lives with parents. Her parents love her very much and support her in all deals. 

Shukrona always wanted to provide the family with a good quality of life. She decided to start a new business in animal husbandry in order to get enough income to improve their living conditions. She works at the school as a teacher and has a small salary.  If you will help her with money, she will buy cows. She studied the course ‘To get a success’ from a women's organization and learned skills about business.  Her mother will help her with business. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy cows for her new business. She will get through using the loan and her business will be a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Janireh

texts.en: Janireh, 25 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Oroquieta City with one child. He is earning income from a transport service business. He started almost a year ago now and earns 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. To improve his business, he borrowed 12,000 PHP from GDMPC (which he just joined recently) to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, Janireh’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 49 years old and married with four children between the ages of 2 and 16 years old. He buys livestock and raises them for re sale.

He has applied for a loan of KES 60,000 to buy more livestock for raising and selling later. This is a trade he has done for the last three years. From the proceeds of his trade, he plans to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to expand by being able to buy more animals so that he can get better profits and sustain his family financially.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Mayranush

texts.en:
Mayranush is still running her clothes trading business. At her stall, she sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothes and sometimes shoes as well. Her business is the main source of income for Mayranush’s family, so the major part of her profit she spends for her family’s needs.
  
Her previous Kiva loan was used to buy a large lot of clothes to resell. Now she is asking for a 500.000 AMD loan to buy autumn season clothes and shoes for her business before the beginning of the school year.

loans.use: To buy autumn season clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto, 29 years old, is from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and his wife works as a dressmaker. With the help of his padyak (a bicycle with an attached sidecar and third wheel), Ernesto buys scrap from the neighborhood and resells it for a profit. He usually buys empty bottles, plastic containers, cans and steel. Ernesto is asking for a loan to finance his planned expansion by buying more empty bottles, plastic containers, cans and steel.

Ernesto's income will provide a nutritious diet for his family and pay their electric bill. Any additional income will be reinvested into the business and put aside for savings. It is Ernesto's dream to continue his business and even improve it for a bigger income.

loans.use: to buy more empty bottles, plastic containers, cans and steel

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en: Nieves raises hogs as her business, just like any other entreprenuer in her village. She patiently raises hogs and resells them upon maturity. Nieves is a 54-year-old widow with six children. She carries the burden of raising her children alone. Because of lack of finances, she was unable to send them all to college; some settled into marriage while others had to seek early employment. Nieves is currently sending her youngest child to school. She is now asking for this loan of PHP 12,000 to keep growing healthy hogs. She will buy feed and vaccines to nourish them. In the future, Nieves hopes to keep improving her sales and earn funds to be used for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hogs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 70 kg of fertilizer and to pay workers

loans.name: Ushindi Group

texts.fr:
Mariam fait partie du groupe Ushindi et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 30 ans et est mariée à  Amou, un enseignant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 7 mois à 10ans,dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce des habits  (pagnes) et  elle est aussi tailleur. 

Elle est à son onzième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d'habits à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier et terminer les études.
texts.en:
Mariam is part of the group Ushindi and lives in Bujumbura. She is 30 years old and married to Amou, a teacher. Together they have three children, aged 7 months to 10 years old, of whom two are in school. 

She does commerce in clothing ( 'pagnes', the colorful cloth of western Africa), and she is also a tailor. 

She is on her eleventh loan with Turame. With this KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and to buy a large amount of clothing to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the next few years, she would like to buy a plot of land and to see her children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of clothing to resell

loans.name: Gulpary

texts.en: Gulpary is married and has three children who are between 11 and 17 years old. Her husband is a welder. She always wanted to provide her children with a good education. Since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Gulpary decided to start a new business in animal husbandry in order to generate an income that she can contribute to her home’s finances. If you will help her with money, she will buy cows and sheep. She studied the course ‘To get a success’ from a women's organization and learned skills about business.  Her children will help her with the business. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 2000 TJS to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She will get through using the loan and her business will become a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cows and sheep

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Alice will use the loan to buy a stock of dry maize and beans to sell.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to export cereals, which will increase her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy dry maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mahmad

texts.en:
Mahmad, 37 years old, is a divorcee who has no children. He is very hardworking and kind-natured. He has a lot of friends and all of them love him very much. Mahmad owns his private farm, where he has been producing onions and wheat for 4 years. He grows 0.5 hectares of onions and 0.5 hectares of wheat. Mahmad has been in this line of work since he was a boy, so all of his experience has been dedicated to producing vegetables and crops. He has some workers who work hard to grow crops and vegetables of high quality. Mahmad's products are sold at the local market.

In order to provide his crops with the needed attention, Mahmad is currently requesting a loan of 4,000 TJS so that he can buy fertilizer and seeds and pay for workers' salaries to continue improving his crop production. He hopes to generate more income and take advantage of the high prices being commanded on an international level so that he can maintain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers and to pay for workers' salaries

loans.name: Chheun

texts.en:
Chheun (pictured with her loom), age 44, is single. She lives with her sister in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Chheun is a weaver. She does not have a means of transportation and spends a lot of money on traveling costs, so she decided to apply for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Cerela

texts.en:
Cerela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a candle making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials needed for her candle making business.

Cerela has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Cerela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her candle making business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 25 years old and married with 4 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Eva is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eva has been raising pigs for 5 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam is 25 years old and married with a small kid. She lives in a peaceful village in the Prey Chor district with her family. She works in the same business as her spouse. They help each other manage their two hectares of farmland – primarily growing rice two times a year because she has enough water supplies from the nearby river. Sam is confident that with her experience and farming practices she can improve her farming business. However, Sam needs financial support to invest in it first. Due to lack of capital, Sam has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 riels to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay labor costs incurred in transplanting rice. With the help of this funding, Sam can complete her farm work on time and she hopes to increase her rice production this season.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay labor costs incurred in transplanting rice.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en: Kache is a widowed mother of five adult children who are married. She is 60 years old and keeps herself busy through the sale of tobacco to the neighborhood. Kache lives with her two sons, who provide for her daily bread. She is hardworking and responsible. Kache is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase tobacco for sale. The loan will help her to increase her profit and thus improve her family's welfare. She hopes to grow her business and to cater for her own small expenses without necessarily relying on her sons.

loans.use: to purchase tobacco to sell

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en: Japheth, 66 years old, is a veterinary doctor by profession. He is married to Phoebe and blessed with three children who are 30, 27 and 24 years old. He is in the business of selling animal feed, a business he started 30 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 55,000. He has requested a second loan of KES 50,000 to purchase animal feed to sell. The profit he earns from his business will help him buy additional stock. His dream is to have a well-developed mannufacturing company.

loans.use: To purchase animals feeds for sale.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal (pictured here), age 26, is married with one young son. He lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.
