Sophal and his wife are garment workers. He does not have transportation to get to work, so he decided to apply for a loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting and to drive to work.

loans.name: Manuela Pastora

texts.es: Manuela tiene en Quevedo un pequeño depósito de venta de racimos de plátanos en su domicilio, este negocio le resulta provechoso ya que tiene un patio grande en el cual siembra el producto. En el negocio lleva varios años, pero fue hace poco que tuvo la iniciativa de producir y vender empanada de plátanos. Su preparación no es complicada pero si necesita de un poco de fuerza física, para la fabricación se pone el plátano a cocinar en una olla grande con agua una vez que ablanda se lo empieza a moler con un rodillo hasta obtener una masa compacta y moldeable, luego se lo extiende por una superficie plana hasta hacer un disco que puede variar de tamaños, luego se lo rellena con pollo, carne o queso dependiendo del gusto, antes de servir se fríe en aceite. Como el proceso es un poco largo su esposo le ayuda con el amasado y venta, empiezan desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde o cuando se le termina el producto. El negocio tiene acogida por lo que espera obtener el préstamo con el cual comprara arena, cemento y piedras esto lo hace porque desea arreglar su casa y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Manuela has a small warehouse in her home in Quevedo, where she sells bananas. This business is profitable for her because she has a large courtyard where she sows her produce. She has had this business for several years, but she has only recently started producing and selling banana pies. The preparation is not complicated, but it requires some physical strength. In order to make the pies, one cooks the banana in a large pot with water. Once the banana softens, it is mashed it with a rolling pin until it results in a compact, malleable mass. Then, it is stretched out on a flat surface and shaped into a circle of varying size. This is then filled with chicken, meat, or cheese, depending on preference. Before serving, it is fried in oil. Because the process is a bit long, Manuela's husband helps her with the gathering and the sales. They start at 5:00 am and work until 4:00 pm or when they run out of food. The business is successful, and so she hopes to hopes to obtain this loan. She will use it to buy sand, cement, and stones because she wants to fix up her home and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and stones.

loans.name: Maria Matias

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 63 años de edad, está soltera, tiene 6 hijos, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto a dos de sus hijos.
Ella tiene 6 años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz. La señora María es muy trabajadora, hace tortillas todo el día para sacar el sustento diario y cubrir gastos del hogar. Ella solicita este préstamo de 6,000 Lempiras para hacerle arreglos al local de su negocio, arreglara la hornilla y la chimenea, con esta inversión ella va brindar un mejor servicio y obtener más ingresos. Como meta desea solicitar otro préstamo cuando pague este  para comprar una estufa industrial y mejorar la producción.
texts.en: Maria, 63, is single and has 6 children.  She lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula along with 2 of her children.  For 6 years, she has had a business making and selling corn tortillas.  Maria is very hardworking.  She makes tortillas all day to pay for her daily food and to cover the household expenses.  She is requesting a loan of 6,000 Honduran lempiras to make some repairs to her business.  She will fix the stove and the chimney.  With this investment she will be able to provide better service and obtain more income.  Maria's goal is to request another loan once this one is paid off so that she can buy an industrial stove and improve her production.

loans.use: to make some repairs to the place where she makes her tortillas; she will fix the stove and the chimney

loans.name: Dinavence

texts.en:
Dinavence is 44 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, with five of them currently in school. For the past 13 years, Dinavence has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Dinavence has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more spare parts for resale, and will help Dinavence to generate greater profits and pay for her children’s school fees. 

Dinavence hopes that in the future she will be able to increase capital in the business and she will buy more items like bicycle spare parts. 

Dinavence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dinavence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Agrecio

texts.es: Agrecio tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y tiene 11 hijos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, el es un hombre amable, servicial y muy trabajador. Agrecio comenzó desde hace 6 años a sembrar maíz y a cultivar café, actualmente se dedica a la siembra de yuca, maíz, frijoles y al cultivo de café, su horario laboral es de 6:00 am a 2:00 pm, trabaja en conjunto con sus hijos varones. La ventaja es que el negocio de producción de café y cultivo de milpas en ciertas temporadas resulta ser muy rentable para Agrecio por las buenas cosechas obtenidas de los cultivos. El solicita este préstamo para la compra de abonos, ya que lo necesita para el mejoramiento de la finca y las milpas. El préstamo le ayudaría en gran manera ya que tendrá el capital necesario para invertirlo en la compra de abonos y todo lo necesario para los cultivos para poder obtener mejores cosechas. Los sueños de Agrecio es mejorar su finca para aumentar sus ganancias y comprar mas tierras para aumentar sus cultivos. Este es su primer préstamo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el compromiso de sus pagos.
texts.en: Agrecio is 52, married, and has 11 children. His husband is a housewife. He is a pleasant, obliging, and very hard-working man. Six years ago he started sowing corn and cultivating coffee. He currently cultivates yucca, corn, beans, and coffee. He works from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm, and his sons work with him. Fortunately, Agrecio's coffee production and crops have been very profitable for him in certain seasons, because of the good harvests he has had. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of fertilizers, since he needs some in order to improve his farm and his crops. This loan will help him greatly, as he will have the necessary capital to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and everything necessary for his crops; this will allow him to obtain better harvests. Agrecio's dreams are to improve his farm in order to increase his income, and to buy more lands in order to increase his cultivation. This is his first loan with FAMA and he hopes to be punctual in the payments of his quotas.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn for tortillas.

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en: Enkhtsetseg is a 43-year-old widow. She has a 15-year-old boy whose name is Telmen. Her son attends secondary school. Today, she works as a master tailor at a local sewing company. She lives with her mom, son and sister in a small house which is located in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar and she has decided to renovate it by housing work. Enkhtetseg is requesting a 3,800,000 Mongolian tugrik loan to buy all the necessary renovation materials for the house, such as vacuum windows for keeping the house warm during cold weather, bricks and others. Enkhtsetseg is a hardworking woman who believes that the renovation of her house will improve her son's and family’s living conditions significantly.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials to renovate her very old house

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Angela  con su credikiva, surtió su negocio comprando refrescos e insumos con los cuales aumentó el número de comidas y vendió un poco mas. Tambien hizo mantenimiento a sus herramientas y equipos de trabajo y ahora opera  mejor y es mas productiva; Con esta inversión aumentó el volumen de ventas de sus productos. En la actualidad se prepara para recibir un nuevo credikiva pues va a terminar de adecuar su espacio productivo y surtirá con víveres, ranchos, los cuales comprará en mayor volumen. El éxito de esta inversión radica en que hará una nueva oferta de productos para el desayuno y adicionará nuevos menus a la  hora de la alimentación, para que sus clientes estén cada dia mas satisfechos. Ella envia sus agradecimientos a Kiva porque dice "me ofrecieron la oportunidad de ampliar mi negocio con el dinero que me facilitaron".
texts.en: With her last "credikiva," Angela stocked her business, buying soft drinks and ingredients to increase the number of meals and sell a little more. She  performed maintenance on her tools and work equipment and now she operates better and is more productive. With this new loan, she will increase the volume of her sales. She is currently preparing to receive a new "credikiva." She is going to finish equipping her production space and stock up with food and snacks, which she will buy in a greater volume. The success of this investment will mean that she will offer new products for breakfast and new menu items for the lunch hour, to satisfy her customers more each day. She sends her thanks to Kiva because, she says, "I was offered the opportunity to expand my business with the money they loaned me."

loans.use: to equip her production space and stock up on food and snacks, which she will buy in greater volume

loans.name: Dany Robert

texts.es:
Dany de 35 años, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Nueva Arica que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zona de actividad comercial y crianza de animales menores. El es una persona muy trabajadora y ha demonstrado garn responsabilidad en el pago de su prestamo anterior con Kiva y Edpyme.

Dany cuenta con su negocio propio de preparación y venta de comida, la cual a colocado en su domicilio, actividad que realiza desde  hace algunos años, cuenta con su propia clientela, es conocido en la zona donde vive por la limpieza, la atención y la buena sazón que tiene, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá solventar sus gastos  personales. Ademas, Dany tambien ha empezado a vender productos agroquimicos, lo cual ha sido una idea muy rentable y le ha ayudado a diversificar sus ingresos. Este tipo de negocios es algo nuevo en esta zona y Dany a descubierto que hay demanda para su producto demonstrando ser un imcro emprendedor. Precisamente, esta vez el esta solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para su negocio de agro-quimicos, para  seguir expandiendo este negocio.
texts.en:
Dany, age 35, is single and lives in his parents' home. The home has electricity and running water, and is located in the Nueva Arica district belonging to the province of Chiclayo. This is a commercial zone where small animals are also raised. Dany is a very hard-working person and has demonstrated responsibility in the payment of his previous loan from Kiva and Edpyme.
Dany has his own business, run out of his home, making and selling food. He has been doing this for several years and has his own customer base. His business is known in the area for cleanliness, good customer service, and taste. With his income he will be able to cover his personal costs. Dany has also started selling agricultural chemical products. This has been a very profitable idea and has helped him to diversify his income. This kind of business is new in his area, and Dany has discovered that there is demand for his product and micro business. He is currently requesting a loan of 3000 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This will be used for the purchase of items for his agricultural chemical business, so that he can keep expanding this business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies to expand his agricultural chemical business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, lard, eggs, pastas, and grocery products to stock her business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz, 59 years old, is married and has 4 children. For the past 5 years, she has been in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Beatriz has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She has previously borrowed 25 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Beatriz would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Ella

texts.en: Ella  is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. NWTF is relisting Ella's business profile in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is widowed and she works hard to support her family. For the past 40 years, Flora has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers. In the future, Flora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin and his wife are farmers. They grow vegetables such as cauliflower and cucumber on their farmland in the village where they live. They have been married since 1987 and have three sons and one daughter. One of their children is married and lives separately, one has full-time employment and two attend school. The family lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sin has previously asked for a Kiva loan. He is requesting a new loan of $1,200 to buy a motorized hand tiller.

loans.use: To buy a motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, 46 years old, is married and she works hard to provide for her family. For the past 5 years, she has been operating a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from making and selling peanut butter.

Gina has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari sari store. Gina has previously borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan is a construction worker and his wife, Sambo, is a garment worker. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City and have five children - four sons and one daughter. Two of their children are garment workers, one is a driver and two attend school. 

Sophan has previously requested two Kiva loan cycles. He is now asking for another loan of $500 to build a kitchen in his house.

loans.use: To build a kitchen in his house.

loans.name: Saidodkhom

texts.en: Saidodkhon is from Tajikistan. It is a country where one can disconnect from the noise and appreciate the beauty of nature through its stunning scenery. Saidodkhon loves his country. He is 52 years old and is married with four children. To make a living, he sells food items in the local market. He has been engaged in his business for six years and earns little money for these activities. Saidodkhon works around 10 hours a day. He enjoys his work and believes it is going well because he always loves what he does. He is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD which will be used to buy more food items to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more food to increase his range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Muli

texts.en:
Muli, 50 years old, is married and blessed with five children. For the last 14 years, he has run a tire repair and sales business in Marigat, earning an average monthly income of KES 30,000.

Muli has borrowed a third loan of KES 50,000, after successfully repaying his previous loan. He intends to use this loan to purchase new and used tires for resale. He anticipates getting profits which he will use to expand his business. Muli hopes to improve his living standards and save money to start an auto parts business.

loans.use: To purchase tires for resale

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 3 years, she has operated a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Josefina has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items such as blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing. In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta, 54 years old, is married and has 11 children. For the past 8 years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Julieta also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Julieta works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Safarmahmad

texts.en:
Safarmahmad is married and has three children, whom he has always wanted to provide with a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that three years ago he began his own business with driving. 

Thanks to good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving.   Now his children are able to get a good education, and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. 

Safarmahmad is asking for a loan of USD 1,000  to repair his car.  In this way he will be able to provide better service and to increase his income.  That will allow him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To repair his car for his taxi service.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 54 years old and married.

Ma. Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Ma. Elena has borrowed, and repaid, no fewer than 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years.  She also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Ma. Elena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng and her husband are farmers. They grow lotus on their farmland in their village. The couple is old, but still strong enough to work. They have four children; three are married and live separately and one assists his parents in the farming business. 

Heng is applying for a loan of $1,200 to help buy a motorbike for her married daughter who is a garment worker. She will use the money from the loan to buy a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.use: To help buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Ho

texts.en:
Ho is 60 years old and lives in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. He operates a farm as well as a business carving mortars in his village. He is married to a humble resident and has five children who are married already. During the rainy season, Ho spends much of his time in the rice field. He devotes his spare time at home to making mortars and pestles for additional income. Ho tries hard to complete his daily tasks, because he is eager to uplift his standard of living someday.

Ho is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 riels to purchase raw granite mortars used in his business. He hopes that he will be able to increase the volume of his production through this loan. He is very thankful for the loan, as it’s his second one. He never made any late payments the previous time.

loans.use: to purchase raw granite mortars used in his business.

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.en: Shafoat is 49 years old and married. For the past 17 years, he has sold stationery such as notebooks, pens, pencils, scissors, etc. to earn a living. Through financial support from friends, he has managed to grow his business. Shafoat dreams of expanding his business and becoming prosperous in the future. He needs a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy seasonal stationery for increasing his business assets. He is looking for your help.

loans.use: To buy seasonal stationery

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is now 56 years old and a widow, with four children. She manages a hog-raising business as the source of her income. She has a strong determination to succeed for her family's sake. 

Wilma usually offer her hogs to butchers and gains PHP 3,000 for each hog she sells.  She has spent her earnings on meals and daily needs of her children. 

Now, she has insufficient funds in the business.  She is asking for additional capital of PHP 9,000 to buy feed and medicines for her hogs. 

She hopes to keep generating good income from her small business and pay her children's school fees on time. She also promises to be responsible in repaying her loan.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her hogs.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 36 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, both currently in school. For the past 3 years, Julius has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells rice, dry beans, sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Julius has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities such as sugar, dry beans and maize flour for resale, and will help Julius to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Julius hopes that, in the future, he will be able to expand the business into a big business such as a wholesale shop. 

Julius is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Julius who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities such as sugar, dry beans and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Naroeun

texts.en:
Naroeun (pictured with her loom) is a silk weaver and her husband, Ra, is a motor taxi driver. He also supplements their income with a new business buying, growing and selling small trees. 

Naroeun has been married since 1996 and has one young daughter. She lives in a village across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Nareoun has previously asked for a Kiva loan. She is now requesting another loan in the amount of $1,500 to help raise capital for her husband to buy more small trees for sale.

loans.use: To help her husband's business by buying more small trees for sale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 37 years old and has eight children. She is married and has six children who are in school. Gina is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 11,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. Gina has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, 35 years old, is from Magalalag, where she lives with her spouse and two children. She has managed a small store for almost five years. Her daily income of PHP 300 goes for meals and allowances for her children, with the rest used to maintain the business. Emma would like to increase her merchandise to meet all her customers' demands, looking for good products to buy. She is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy eggs, soft drinks, biscuits and soap to sell in her store.

Emma hopes to have a profitable business to help with her children's education and to extend good and friendly service towards her customers.

loans.use: to buy eggs, soft drinks, biscuits and soap to sell in her store

loans.name: Munkhbat

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhbat, 35, sews goods in a leather factory in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He lives with his wife, son and his invalid brother in an old house in the ger district (a ger is a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt). He bought his house and land plot in 2002 with his savings and support from his relatives. However, it has not had any repairs since the family moved in there. 

In winter, they feel very cold and always have illnesses due to the cold, and due to smoke from the coal fire stoves they use to stay warm. Munkhbat knows that using coal fuel is harmful to the health of his family and the environment. So he has decided to repair his house in order to reduce the coal usage for the heating. At first he is planning to insulate the walls and renovate the windows to reduce heat loss. He calculates that it will cost about 1,800,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy building materials to repair his house.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Chuluuntogtokh

texts.en: Mr. Chuluuntogtokh, 25 has been running a taxi since 2010. He lives with his wife and his son in a ger, Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works as a vendor in the bazaar and earns not enough. Since last year, he has been building a small wooden house for his family. Building is at 80% of processing and he wanted to buy some insulation materials to the walls. In winter, most of the Mongolian households use the coal fired stoves to stay warm at home /using the wood or other chemical fuels are unaccepted in Mongolia due to the harmful and less forest source/. Making the wall insulation is one of the good ways to reduce the usage of the coal fuel in Mongolia. As we know that the coal usage influences worst to the air pollution and health of people. So that he decided to buy the some building materials such as the foam, cement to the wall insulation. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to make the wall insulation to his building family house.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his rundown house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, aged 34, is a street vender. She sells pure drinking water, soft drinks, and snack foods at the riverside in front of the royal palace where she is visited by local people and tourists every day. She typically earns approximately 12,000 KHR per day to add to her husband’s main income. Chan has been in this type of business for two years. Chan is married to a humble man who provides a tuk-tuk transportation service around Phnom Penh city. Together, they have given birth to two children who are currently single.

Chan would like to get a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 KHR to purchase merchandise to sell such as soft drinks, pure drinking water, and snack foods. She hopes that she will be able to make her business more profitable and yield a better income. Chan is confident that she can pay her loan back to our lenders on time.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell such as soft drinks, pure drinking water, and snack foods

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak, 31, is a garment worker who lives in a suburb of Phom Penh. Her husband, Peng, is 30 years old and has a business buying and selling recycling materials. The couple have been married since 2010 and have no children yet.

Vannak is asking for her first Kiva loan in the amount of $1,200 in order to provide her husband with capital to buy additional recycling materials to sell.

loans.use: To provide her husband with capital to buy additional recycling materials to sell.

loans.name: Lauriana

texts.en: Lauriana works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Lauriana requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving. Lauriana has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Lauriana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Marietes

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Marietes works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from her chicken-vending and fermented duck egg (balut)-selling business. Marietes is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Marietes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 72 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of  22,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional stocks for her general store.

Adelaida has already taken out and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and a boarding house.

Adelaida aspires to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her general store

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea (pictured here) is 52 years old and her husband, Yorng, is 61 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1978 and have five children - three sons and two daughters. Two of the children are married and live separately, one is a garment worker, another one operates a business installing cell phone applications and Mp3 and Mp4 players, and the other stays at home. 

Chea sells groceries at home, while her husband is an electrician. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,500 to expand her grocery inventory by buying more grocery items. This will help Chea to better respond to her customers' needs.

loans.use: to expand her grocery inventory by buying more grocery items.

loans.name: Deodima

texts.en:
Deodima is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more items like pants, bags, blouses, and other pieces of clothing.

NWTF is relisting Deodima's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more items like pants, bags, blouses, and other pieces of clothing

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 66 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoos, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Adelaida has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, shampoos, eggs, spices, etc. 

In the future, Adelaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie is a 33-year-old lady. She is married to a 43-year-old man named Alex. From their marriage, Debbie and Alex are blessed with 3 children: Franko, 14, who is studying at a junior high school; Lita, 7, who is studying at an elementary school; and Viona, 5, who is attending kindergarten.

Debbie operates a kiosk business. The income from the business enables her to provide for the needs of her family. Daily, basic needs such as instant noodles, snacks, sugar, bath soaps, detergents, candy, frying oil, wheat flour, etc. are available at her kiosk. Debbie is thinking of improving her kiosk business by completing her inventory with more items as demanded by her customers. She requested a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on cigarettes, beverages, biscuits, cooking oil, detergent, instant noodles, and petrol to be sold in front of her kiosk.

loans.use: To purchase cigarettes, beverages, biscuits, cooking oil, detergent, instant noodles, and petrol to be sold in front of her kiosk

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcyle.

Angelita has been in this business for 10 years and she also earns extra income from raising livestock. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan is 20 years old and is studying at a university. He is the youngest child in his family and has been helping his parents run their kiosk business for the past 4 years. The kiosk business is located at the traditional market. Alan usually starts working at the business after completing his course. 

At the moment, Alan is thinking of improving the business. He would like to add more kiosk stock i.e., sugar, coffee, snacks, bread, and also several new items i.e., eggs, betel vine, and palm sugar. To do so, Alan has requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 6,000,000. He is expecting that the loan assistance will have a good impact on the business.

loans.use: to add more kiosk stock i.e., sugar, coffee, snacks, bread, and also several new items i.e., eggs, betel vine, and palm sugar.

loans.name: Fuente De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
La señora Nancy Yanet esta casad, tiene 20 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la crianza de animales, inicio este negocio con sus padres ya que sus padres tenían crianza de gallinas y luego las vendían, ella lleva ahats ael mom3ento 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo  que lo utilizara para la compra de pollos y gallinas parea crianza, ya que quiere tener una granja grande, y así mejorar su ganancias cuando corresponda venderlos. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la artesanía y al comercio. Una de las integrantes de la foto no califico para el préstamo.
texts.en:
Nancy Yanet is married, twenty years old, and [has] six years of primary education.  She devotes her [energies] to domestic duties and raising animals.  She started this business with her parents since they had [experience] breeding hens and later selling them.  At this moment, Nancy has five years of experience [in this line of work].

She [has] organized a group for the [purpose of] requesting a loan.  [Her portion of the loan] will be used for the purchase of chickens and hens to raise since she has the desire to have a large farm.  Likewise, [the additional animals] will increase her profits when it comes time to sell them.  The other members of the group work in the craft trade and [general] commerce. 

Note: One of the members in the picture, did not qualify for [this particular] loan.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and hens to raise.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children - 1 of the children is currently in school. For the past 1 year, Amos has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells rice, dry beans, sugar, and soap. 

To help expand his business, Amos has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like rice, soap, and dry beans for resale, and will help Amos to generate greater profits and pay his children's medical bills. Amos hopes that in the future he will be able to build a good house for himself. 

Amos is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amos who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like rice, soap, and dry beans for resale.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort portal region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, with three of them currently in school. For the past three years, Loice has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Loice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Loice to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Loice hopes that in the future she will be able to see her children go to university. 

Loice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Loice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Angelita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim, aged 30, is a farmer who happily lives with her spouse and three children in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. All of her children are in local schools and need her daily allowances. Sim would like to yield more income from her farming business so that she can save it for the future education of her children. She plans to place them in a good college in Phnom Penh.

Due to financial constraints, Sim has requested a loan to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides to install in the farming process and to ensure a fruitful harvest in this coming season. She hopes that it will help improve her income, which she can use to satisfy her household needs and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Fransiska

texts.en:
Fransiska is a 27-year-old lady. She is single and is living with her parents. Fransiska has 2 siblings but they are married and live with their families. 

Fransiska has a kiosk business selling various daily needs, i.e., instant noodles, coffee, margarine, sandals, soy sauce, cooking oil, some snacks, etc. She has been engaged in this business for 3 years. She is grateful for running the business as it enables her to meet her family's daily needs. 

Fransiska would like to improve the income generated by initiating a computer rental business. She would like to buy three computers and printers to be rented. She received information about TLM and was interested in joining their individual lending program. She then submitted the loan application and requested a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 to implement her plan.

loans.use: to buy three computers and printers to be rented.

loans.name: Ynes

texts.es:
Ynes tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y con 3 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente y sus 3 hijos en el Dist de Tambogrande al norte del Peru. Ellos viven en la parte  rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad que desarrolla la ella es la venta de cerveza y piqueos (tapas) en su propio domicilio, en el cual atiende preferencialmente los días sábados, domingos y lunes. Cuenta con clienta ya establecida en la zona y tiene más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio. Su conviviente es agricultor con chacra propia en donde siembra maíz y frijol. Adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola. Entre los dos buscan darle unas buenas condidiones de vida a sus hijos, y es por eso que trabajan juntos. Ynes es parte esensial de la familia. Precisamente ella busca un prestamo para consolidar su negocio. En particular, el destino del crédito será para la compra de cerveza por cantidad y así obtener mayor margen de ganancia. Esta estrategia le ayudara  co su negocio.
texts.en:
Ynes is 30 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and has three children in her care. She lives in her own house with her partner and their three children in the district of Tambogrande in the north of Peru. They live in the rural part of the district, but they have electrical service.

The business that she is developing is the sale of beer and snacks (tapas) in her own home, where she serves preferentially on Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays. She already has regular customers in the zone and she has more than 3 years of experience in her business. Her partner is a farmer with his own farm where he plants corn and beans. In addition, he works as an agricultural laborer. Between the two of them, they seek to give good living conditions to their children, and this is why they work together. Ynes is an essential part of the family.  She is seeking a loan precisely to strengthen her business. In particular, the  destiny of the loan will be to purchase beer in quantity and thus obtain a better profit margin. This strategy will help her in her business.

loans.use: to purchase beer in quantity and thus obtain a better profit margin

loans.name: Mukhfuza

texts.en:
Mukhfuza is 45 years old. She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead. Mamajan is her partner. They have 1 child and they love him very much. They live together in a big house.

She sells a variety of fabrics for women's dresses. She stores her merchandise in a local market in her town. She makes periodic trips to accomplish her goal. She began working this way over 5 years ago because she needed to earn money. Currently, her partner helps her to purchase her merchandise.  As a result of the good results she is having, she wishes to increase her business by selling new seasonable cloth. She is asking for a loan of 4000 TJS to buy fabrics for the new season.

This is her fourth loan with Imon International organization, and she is grateful for its financial support in helping her to realize her plans. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of fabrics

loans.name: Turwanyubukene Group

texts.fr:
Assouman  fait partie du groupe Turwanyubukene. Le nom du groupe signifie «lutte contre la pauvreté». Il a 33 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 1 ans à 7 ans, dont 2 scolarise. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Assouman est agriculteur des riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 70kgs des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre dans son agriculture de riz.
Pour faire croitre son agriculture des riz, il planifie de demande d’autre prêt pour finance ses activités. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait devenir un grand cultivateur des riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Assouman is a member of the Turwanyubukene group. The group’s name means “combating poverty.” He is 33 years old. He is married, with four children ranging from one to seven years of age, two of whom are in school. In addition to his children, he has one other dependent. His educational level is six years of primary school.

Assouman is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan in order to buy 70 kg [154 lbs] of fertilizers and pay the cost of labor for his rice farm.

In order to expand his business, he plans to request other loans to finance his activities. In the years to come, he would like to become a major rice producer. He plans to use his revenues to pay for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy 70 kg of fertilizers and pay the cost of labor for his rice farm.

loans.name: Jubelyn

texts.en: Jubelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Jubelyn requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving. She has been in this business for 3 years now and also earns additional income from raising hogs. In the future, Jubelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Inatullo

texts.ru: Инатулло родился 1984 году в районе Хамадони. Он женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Инатулло живет вместе с родителями. Его отец работает учителем. Жена Инатулло домохозяйка. Сам Инатулло уже год как занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку на центральном рынке района, где занимается торговлей обуви. Инатулло просит кредит для приобретения детской и подростковой осеней обуви.
texts.en: Inatullo was born in 1984 in Hamadoni. He is married and has one child. Inatullo and his family live with his parents. His father works as a teacher. Inatullo's wife is a home maker and Inatullow himself works in retail. He rents a market stall at the central market where he sells shoes. Inatullo is requesting this loan to purchase a batch of fall season shoes for children and teenagers.

loans.use: to purchase fall season shoes for children and adolescents

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 21 years old and a single man from Naivasha. He has a quarry business that he has been doing for the past three years. 

David has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy new blocks of quarry ground.

He hopes to grow his business and open a spare parts shop in Mai Mahiu in the near future.

loans.use: To buy new blocks

loans.name: Alie

texts.ru:
В сельском хозяйстве Алие  начинала свою работу агрономом. С 2003г., уже как женщина фермер, она на паевых участках выращивает виноград и землянику. 
После смерти мужа ей помогают 23-х летний сын, который учится в Национальной академии природно-охранного и курортного строительства и 22-х летняя дочь, которая учится в Таврическом национальном университете.
Обрабатывать участок в размере 0.11 га семье очень сложно, поэтому Алие  нанимает работников. 
Для обработки земли было принято решение приобрести мотоблок, который ускорит вспашку земли и понизит количество сорняков.
Алие очень благодарит за ту  помощь, которую оказывает АКМ. АКМ вернуло ей смысл к жизни после смерти мужа и придало стремление к развитию ее фермерского хозяйства.  В дальнейшем она планирует приобрести бензиновый опрыскиватель для растений. 
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования бензинового опрыскивателя.
texts.en:
Alie started her agricultural work as a plan specialist at the kolhoz. In 2003 she became an independent female farmer and has been growing grapes and strawberries on her allocated plot of land. After Alie's husband passed away her children continued to help her with the farm. Alie has a 23 year old son who is a student at the National Academy of environmental preservation and tourism and a 22 year old daughter who is studying at the Tavric National university. However, to take care of everything on her 0.11 hectare/0.3 acre plot of land is a big job and Alie also hires a farmhand to help her. To improve soil condition Alie decided to purchase a motorized tiller which will help her til the soil faster and reduce the number of weeds. 

Alie is very grateful for the help that AKM is offering. AKM returned to her the meaning of life after her husband passed away and gave her the dedication to succeed in her farming business. In the future Alie plans to purchase a motorized sprayer for her plants. She needs to take out this loan to purchase this piece of equipment.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Saidbahrom

texts.ru: Саидбахром трудолюбивый, женатый человек и на воспитании имеет одного сына. Он живет отдельно от родителей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 2 года назад, Саидбахром начал свой бизнес. Он продает телефоны, диски и аксессуары в магазине, который находится в центре его города. Его жена преподает в университете и имеет маленькую зарплату. Саидбахром запрашивает кредит на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки товара, чтобы пополнить оборотный капитал. Он ждет вашу доброту
texts.en: Saidbahrom is a hard working family man who is raising one son. He and his family live separately from his parents. His wife teaches at the university and earns a very small salary. Two years ago Saidbahrom opened a business in order to provide for his family. He sells mobile phones, CDs and accessories in his centrally located media store in Khujand. He is requesting a loan of 3000 US dollars to purchase goods for his store and have more capital for big store purchases. Saidbahrom is hoping for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones, CDs and other goods to expand inventory
